FullDescriptions:
Summary
Sling TV L.L.C. provides an over-the-top (internet delivered) television experience on TVs, tablets, gaming consoles, computers, smartphones, smart TVs and other streaming devices. Distributed across a variety of strategic device partners, including Google, Amazon, Apple TV, Microsoft, Roku, Samsung, LG, Comcast, and many others, Sling TV offers two primary domestic streaming services that collectively include more than 100 channels of top content. Featured programmers include Disney/ESPN, NBC, AMC, A&E, EPIX, NFL Network, NBA TV, NHL Networks, Pac-12 Networks, Hallmark, Viacom, and more. For Spanish-speaking customers, Sling Latino offers a suite of standalone and extra Spanish-programming packages tailored to the U S. Hispanic market. And for those seeking International content, Sling International currently provides more than 300 channels in 20 languages (available across multiple devices) to U.S. households.
Sling TV is the #1 Live TV Streaming Service Sling TV is a next-generation service that meets the entertainment needs of today's contemporary viewers. Visit www.Sling.com. We are driven by curiosity, pride, adventure, and a desire to win – it's in our DNA. We're looking for people with boundless energy, intelligence, and an overwhelming need to achieve to join our team as we embark on the next chapter of our story.

Opportunity is here. We are Sling.

Job Duties and Responsibilities
The Marketing Data Analyst Lead will have a direct impact on growing the Sling business. Including helping us optimize performance in current Sling subscriber acquisitions and in supporting marketing, programming, and the digital team as Sling continues to drive the future of entertainment and interactivity. We're looking for those with the capability and desire to position themselves and the Sling business for rapid growth.

The position will focus on producing accurate, practical insights that improve our effectiveness in acquiring and retaining the right consumers. The role will utilize data to track leads, build reports, understand customers, perform early signal analysis, and more. The role will evolve to help automate these processes and to work closely with customer acquisition leads to create and manage strategies aimed at maximizing the effectiveness of marketing campaigns. Where it goes from there… you get to help us decide.

As part of the Finance, Strategy and Analytics team, the Marketing Data Analyst Lead will be responsible for building and maintaining reporting, analysis viewership and customer behaviors, evaluating product performance and make appropriate recommendations to programming, marketing, and digital teams. This includes using advanced statistical models, developing and maintaining analytic infrastructure, rigorous program analysis, creating and running advanced queries and reports, and performing customer analyses.

Responsibilities include:

Leverage SQL development skills to perform full-lifecycle data mining activities including requirements analysis, data quality assessment, data profiling, design and development of analytic data sets, data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) from both relational databases and flat-file sources.
Work with internal clients to understand requirements and potential uses for predictive models, descriptive models, and marketing reports.
Provide analytical support for strategy development, measurement design, and post-campaign analysis.
Provide support for ad-hoc analytical projects, including customer-level analysis, segmentation analysis, product affinity, and customer profiling analysis.
Work with unstructured data sets and cleanse that data to make recommendations, using various tools like Redshift, Teradata, Tableau, and SQL server.#LI-JS1
#LI-SLING1

Title: GIS Data Analyst
Qualifications:
Prefer bachelor's degree in Graphic Information Systems (GIS), Computer Science, or related Geoscience discipline
2+ years of experience in GIS database operations preferably in the Oil and Gas Industry.
Strong knowledge and working experience with GIS automated mapping, spatial information processing systems, methods and techniques.
Know the principals and practices of cartography and automated mapping, map projections & coordinate systems.
General knowledge of the Oil and Gas Industry and terminology related but not limited to land acreage, well databases, and well plan maps.
Familiarity with Drilling Info web based platform and other state Oil and Gas commissions and databases.
Critical thinker with the ability to solve problems independently, demonstrate innovative approach.
Detail oriented -needs to be organized, responsible and detail orientated. Skill to perform work accurately and thoroughly with devotion to detail.
Proactive - must be able to rapidly, concisely, and aggressively manage up to ensure critical issues are escalated to management, resolved, and acted upon before there is impact on the organization.
Ability to prioritize - must be able to prioritize a lot of dissimilar issues across multiple project and offer guidance to other resources on what is most important, and also escalate critical issues to management for follow-up action.
Ability to meet deadlines - must be able to hit critical deadlines by a certain time without exception.
FullDescriptions:
The Geophysics Team Lead applies Geographic Information Systems (GIS) principals to produce deliverables that assist the Geophysics team in their work. The position aids in the design, planning, and execution of geophysical investigations and projects including data collection, processing, analyzing, and reporting. The Geophysics Team Lead has knowledge of commonly-used concepts, practices, and procedures within Geoscience, Geomagnetics, the Oil and Gas Industry and Geographic Information Systems. Additionally, this role is responsible for assisting management with creating / enhancing processes and procedures to perform the functions of the job.
Job duties include, but are not limited to the following:
Work with Geophysics and Sales team to deliver high-quality GIS products to customers.
Will create high quality maps, GIS analysis, and data to support a variety of Geophysical projects and sales support initiatives including: aeromagnetic data coverage maps, magnetic maps, remote sensing maps, Oil and Gas well data analysis maps, and a variety of client activity maps.
Perform quality control, monitoring, and interpretation of GIS data and deliverables.
Geotechnician duties related to well data base management in Petra software and data mining of various data platforms including IHS Enerdeq, Drilling Info, and State Regulatory Agencies.
Revise existing GIS layers and create new layers following established standards and procedures.
Correct geospatial location of features based on aerial photography or topography.
Coordinate, delegate, and QAQC work assignments with ArcGIS analyst in India office.
Make recommendations to management on how to enhance the processes / procedures of their day-to-day work to deliver high quality, cost effective solutions to customers.
Foster technical solutions, enhance project execution efficiency, ensure effective team participation.
Qualifications:
Prefer bachelor's degree in Graphic Information Systems (GIS), Computer Science, or related Geoscience discipline
2+ years of experience in GIS database operations preferably in the Oil and Gas Industry.
Strong knowledge and working experience with GIS automated mapping, spatial information processing systems, methods and techniques.
Know the principals and practices of cartography and automated mapping, map projections & coordinate systems.
General knowledge of the Oil and Gas Industry and terminology related but not limited to land acreage, well databases, and well plan maps.
Familiarity with Drilling Info web based platform and other state Oil and Gas commissions and databases.
Critical thinker with the ability to solve problems independently, demonstrate innovative approach.
Detail oriented -needs to be organized, responsible and detail orientated. Skill to perform work accurately and thoroughly with devotion to detail.
Proactive - must be able to rapidly, concisely, and aggressively manage up to ensure critical issues are escalated to management, resolved, and acted upon before there is impact on the organization.
Ability to prioritize - must be able to prioritize a lot of dissimilar issues across multiple project and offer guidance to other resources on what is most important, and also escalate critical issues to management for follow-up action.
Ability to meet deadlines - must be able to hit critical deadlines by a certain time without exception.

Title: Professional Research Assistant
Qualifications: Minimum of Bachelor's degree or equivalent in biological or health-related Field.Minimum of 2 years of experience adhering to research or clinical protocols.Available to work on Monday-Friday as early as 7:00 am on rare occasions when needed.Valid driver's license, reliable personal transportation and the ability to travel overnight for investigator meetings.Experience with conducting the Informed Consent Process.COMIRB and HIPAA requirement for researchers must be met during week 1 of employment.Must abide by hospital, University, local, state, and national regulations regarding human subject research.
FullDescriptions:
University of Colorado School of Medicine

University of Colorado | CU Anschutz Medical Campus
School of Medicine, Department of Pediatrics
Section of Infectious Disease
Professional Research Assistant
Position #765778 – Requisition #17208

* Applications are accepted electronically ONLY at www.cu.edu/cu-careers *

The University of Colorado Anschutz Medical Campus seeks individuals with demonstrated commitment to creating an inclusive learning and working environment. We value the ability to engage effectively with students, faculty and staff of diverse backgrounds.

The Department of Pediatrics, Section of Infectious Disease has an opening for a full-time (unclassified) Professional Research Assistant position.

The University of Colorado Anschutz Medical Campus is a public education, clinical and research facility serving 4,500 students, and a world-class medical destination at the forefront of life-changing science, medicine, and healthcare. CU Anschutz offers more than 42 highly rated degree programs through 6 schools and colleges, and receives over $500 million in research awards each year. We are the single largest health professions education provider in Colorado, awarding nearly 1,450 degrees annually. Powered by our award-winning faculty, renowned researchers and a reputation for academic excellence, the CU Anschutz Medical Campus drives innovation from the classroom to the laboratory to the delivery of unparalleled patient care. Read CU Anschutz Quick Facts here.

PLEASE NOTE: Candidates may be responsible for travel expenses related to the interview process and any relocation expenses, if applicable.

Nature of Work:
This is a 100% FTE position for a PRA in the Pediatric Infectious Diseases Department at the University of Colorado Denver Anschutz Medical Campus. This full-time position will assist in conducting clinical trials and research projects at Children's Hospital Colorado and University of Colorado Denver.

Areas of Responsibility:
Clinical ResearchServing as a clinical research coordinator for industry sponsored and investigator-initiated research projects.Performing clinical trial subject screening, recruitment, interviews, and follow-up visits, study paperwork, communications with Industry Sponsors, monitoring visits, study data entry, and overall study management.Developing study team SOPs for study procedures.Research Regulatory ManagementAssisting with all regulatory activities required to implement and maintain the clinical research endeavors.
Other Research Activities
Assisting the study data analyst with Access database development, building queries and reports.Preparing reports to assist administrative assistant with billing, study accounting, and subject payment.

Examples of Work Performed:Collaborate with principal investigators, investigators, and other hospital personnel to enroll clinical trial patients.Screen and assist in assessment of patients' eligibility in multiple ongoing prospective clinical research study protocols.Complete the entire consent process, including approaching patients and explaining study procedures and consent forms, answering questions concerning the studies, and obtaining signatures for informed consent and assent from patients and caregivers.Perform and/or coordinate study visit events.Instruct clinical staff on their study roles.Ensure accurate completion of data collection forms.Perform accurate data entry and query resolution.Perform follow-up interviews, both in person and via telephone.Some unskilled clinical care duties, including laboratory work.Study database maintenance.Other duties necessary to completion of research studies.Comply with the hospital and IRB policies and procedures for conducting good clinical trials.Collecting, processing and storing samples for research.Medication compliance tracking and coordinating protocol procedures.Assist the PI in collecting and reporting all patient reported adverse drug reactions and other serious adverse events.Patient education and follow-up per protocol guidelines.Routine meetings with monitors to reconcile data management issues.Participation in investigator's meetings.Preparing and submitting compliance documentation for the institutional review boards.Submission to the Human Research Subjects Portal for UCHRSS review and approval.Abstracting data from patient charts and electronic medical records.Research administrative tasks such as incentive mailing and tracking, data entry into web-based systems; updating local tracking database to reflect patient status. Participation in study meetings and trainings.Other study projects as necessary.
This position works primarily Monday through Friday day hours. Occasional weeknights and weekends are required. Occasional overnight travel for visits or training is required


Salary and Benefits:
Salary is negotiable and commensurate with skills and experience.
The University of Colorado offers a full benefits package. Information on University benefits programs, including eligibility, is located at Employee Services.

University of Colorado Denver | Anschutz Medical Campus is dedicated to ensuring a safe and secure environment for our faculty, staff, students and visitors. To assist in achieving that goal, we conduct background checks for all new employees prior to their employment.

The Immigration Reform and Control Act requires that verification of employment eligibility be documented for all new employees by the end of the third day of work. Alternative formats of this ad are available upon request for persons with disabilities.

Your total compensation goes beyond the number on your paycheck. The University of Colorado provides generous leave, health plans and retirement contributions that add to your bottom line.

The University of Colorado Denver | Anschutz Medical Campus is committed to recruiting and supporting a diverse student body, faculty and administrative staff. The university strives to promote a culture of inclusiveness, respect, communication and understanding. We encourage applications from women, ethnic minorities, persons with disabilities and all veterans. The University of Colorado is committed to diversity and equality in education and employment.


Qualifications

Minimum Qualifications:Minimum of Bachelor's degree or equivalent in biological or health-related Field.Minimum of 2 years of experience adhering to research or clinical protocols.Available to work on Monday-Friday as early as 7:00 am on rare occasions when needed.Valid driver's license, reliable personal transportation and the ability to travel overnight for investigator meetings.Experience with conducting the Informed Consent Process.COMIRB and HIPAA requirement for researchers must be met during week 1 of employment.Must abide by hospital, University, local, state, and national regulations regarding human subject research.

Preferred Qualifications:Experience working on clinical trialsExperience working with children with respiratory illnessesComputer experience, with an Electronic Medical Records system

Competencies:Ability to implement and closely follow research protocols.Ability to communicate clearly the study procedures to parents and children.Some knowledge of medical terminology, particularly relating to symptoms of infectious diseases.Data collection skills, including interview administration.Organizational skills to document and process research study results.This is a position requiring research experience and an interest in clinical research.

Conditions of Employment:Must successfully pass a 10-panel drug test through Children's Hospital ColoradoMust be willing and able to pass a national criminal and sex-offender background check


Special Instructions to Applicants: Questions should be directed to Paige Miller at Paige.Miller@childrenscolorado.org


Application Materials Required: Cover Letter, Resume/CV, List of References

Application Materials Instructions: * Applications are accepted electronically ONLY at www.cu.edu/cu-careers * Review of applications will begin immediately and will continue until the position is closed.


Applications are accepted electronically at CU Careers, refer to requisition ID: 17208

A current Resume/CV
The names, addresses, daytime telephone numbers and e-mail addresses for three professional references, either attached to your resume/CV or uploaded as a separate document
Please be advised that the University does check references as part of the employment process.

FullDescriptions:
Business Intelligence Analyst II
Job Description
RAY • ALLEN is looking for a detail-oriented, creative problem solver for our full-time Business Intelligence Analyst II position. The candidate will be part of our Data Engineering team and will be developing and maintaining BI Dashboards primarily using Qlik Sense and helping steer new analytics projects. This will involve: gathering requirements, data cleanup, forming ETL processes, creating unique data models, designing mockups, meeting with stakeholders, analyzing data, formulating KPIs, and crafting dashboards and reports.
In addition to creating BI Dashboards, you will also be integral in developing and standardizing processes to gather data and/or connect to data sources, automation and scripting, business workflows, and working with leadership teams to promote the use of self-service BI. Through effective, accurate, and efficient interpretation of data, you will improve the company's overall business acumen.
You are someone who is eager to learn and seeks out new challenges. You have a knack for problem-solving and consider yourself a creative, curious, and out-of-the-box thinker. You stay meticulously organized in pressure situations. Last but not least, you are a skilled communicator, adept at explaining complex results to non-technical audiences.
Job Duties & Responsibilities
Work with internal and external teams to collect, analyze, and report data to meet customer/business needs
Use Excel and other tools to mine, explore, clean up, organize, and do initial analysis on large data sets
Create ETL process and data models to achieve desired outcome, primarily using Qlik Sense scripting
Create dashboards, stories, and processes primarily using Qlik Sense
Work with Project Managers and others to explore problems and conduct data analysis
Perform exploratory data analysis and audit reports to locate and resolve errors and discover actionable insights
Gather and build requirements documents and task out projects
Maintains internal data sets and tables within tools or standard templates
Drive implementation, training, and adaptation of tools and reports
Interact with and proactively communicate with teams regarding issues and new ideas
Support tools and processes for data analysis and reporting
Document standards and procedures when creating reports
Use advanced analytical techniques when required
Other duties as assigned
Skills & Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in STEM, Business, Economics, or related field or equivalent work experience
2-4 years' experience as a Business Intelligence Analyst, Data Analyst, and/or Reporting Analyst
2+ years' experience in development, design, and implementation with Qlik Sense or similar BI platform such as Tableau, Looker, PowerBI, etc.
Intermediate SQL skills and experience with creating de-normalized or star-schema database models
Intermediate programming/scripting skills (Python, R, VBA, and JavaScript a plus)
Intermediate to Advanced Microsoft Excel skills (e.g., nested logical and lookup functions, pivot tables, macros)
Understanding of statistics and analytical techniques, such as linear regressions, time series analysis, etc.
Demonstrated problem-solving and analytical skills with open-ended problems
Ability to work independently and in a cross-functional team environment
Positive attitude, strong work ethic, time-management skills, and ability to communicate effectively with internal and external teams
Very detail-oriented and highly organized
Leadership and/or Project Management skills a plus
Understanding of IT asset management, networking equipment, and contract management a plus
Company Profile
Founded in 2004, RAY ALLEN helps enterprises manage assets and IT investments via its RACSystem solution that delivers information and updates to its customers in an efficient and cost effective manner. The web based application saves both time and expenses for the business by managing the maintenance contracts and financial implications, such as procurement, accounting, software licenses and overseeing the maintenance renewal process. RAY ALLEN's flagship application, RACSystem and its underlying platform is in production in over 1000 enterprises and supports multiple manufacturers in over 140 countries around the world, working with the largest VARS as well as Fortune 2000 companies. Learn more by visiting http://www.rayalleninc.com.

FullDescriptions:
Bigger challenges. Bolder ideas. Global impact. At Viasat, we’re on a mission to deliver connections with the capacity to change the world. We’re the company behind the world’s fastest satellite internet service, with technology that’s helping to bridge the digital divide and improve life for our customers around the globe. By providing powerful new ways for people to connect with one another, gain greater access to education, entertainment, medical research, commerce, and much more, our team is empowering millions of customers worldwide.
We’re growing rapidly and looking for passionate, innovative professionals to join our team and connect the world to more. You’ll work in a collaborative and inclusive environment that values diverse perspectives and continuous learning, and provides industry-leading benefits with unmatched opportunities for career growth. Our team is fearless in pursuit of new ideas and uncompromising in our quest to become the world’s first truly global Internet Service Provider. Interested in joining our mission? Take a look at career opportunities at Viasat today.

Job Responsibilities

Do you love finding answers to business questions that haven’t been asked yet? Can you apply business and technical expertise in the aggregation, storage and dissemination of data that empowers an organization to self-serve their analytical needs? Looking for the chance to drive organizational efficiency and change through your analytical insight? Come join a diverse team of technical and business professionals at Viasat!
As a Data Analyst on the Field Operations Analytics & Reporting team, you will participate in projects relating to the operation of our network of dealers and installers. As you analyze and evaluate data, you will identify opportunities for growth and propose creative solutions using data-driven insights. You will prioritize work based on changing demands and proactively seek to improve processes and programs through your analytical insights. You will develop innovative solutions to empower the next generation of self-service analytics as we expand into new markets. Best of all, you’ll work with a high-performing team that delivers value to the organization through our analytical efforts.

Requirements

4 Year College Degree in Business, Mathematics, Finance, Economics, or Management Information Systems
1-2 years of experience in data analysis or data management preferred
Working knowledge of SQL (PostgreSQL, Oracle, and/or Microsoft SQL Server)
Attention to detail and accuracy
Effective interpersonal and relationship building skills to effectively work with teammates and business partners
Military education or experience may be considered in lieu of civilian requirements listed


Preferences

Experience with BI tools such as Power BI and Tableau, including design and publication.
Experience with automation of data processing and task scheduling (Alteryx Designer is a plus).
Experience in the Atlassian suite (JIRA, Confluence, HipChat) is helpful, but not required.
Experience with utilizing Python for data analysis is a bonus!
Certifications that would be a great match for this position, but are not required, include:
MCSA: BI Reporting or MCSE: Data Management and Analytics
Alteryx Designer Core, Advanced, and/or Expert
Tableau Desktop Qualified Associate or Certified Professional certification

FullDescriptions:
We are looking for a passionate Data Scientist. The successful candidate will turn data into information, information into insight, insight into business decisions, and decisions into Client Host recommendations. Our Data Scientist will analyze large amounts of raw information to find patterns that will help improve our company recommendations. We will rely on you to build data products to extract valuable business insights. In this role, you should be highly analytical with a knack for analysis, math and statistics. Critical thinking and problem-solving skills are essential for interpreting data. We also want to see a passion for machine-learning and research. Your goal will be to help our company analyze Short-Term Rental Real Estate trends to make better decisions for our clients and internal purchasing.

Title: Business Analyst
FullDescriptions:
Our mission is simple… Be the best lender to Agriculture. In order to deliver on that statement, we have the best people working for us. Headquartered in Santa Rosa, California, with offices throughout California, Colorado, Kansas, Nevada and Oklahoma, we have been serving all segments of the agricultural business for over 100 years!
Benefits offered by American AgCredit:
Commitment to agriculture and our communities we serve
Family friendly work environment
Investment in employee growth, development and training
Medical, Dental and Vision coverage
Outstanding 401k – up to 9% matching!
Generous Vacation Leave (starting at 15 days), 15 Paid Sick Days, and 11 Paid Holidays
Competitive Incentive Compensation Plan
Disability & Life Insurance
Employee fitness and wellness benefits.
Free Soda, Coffee and Snacks!
BASIC FUNCTION:
The Business Analyst will work directly within an Agile team to assess near term needs, issues, and understand the strategic goals of the association. They must be flexible, adaptable, responsive, creative, innovative, and work well in a team environment. In some instances, the BA may be asked to act as a product owner in proxy. A Business Analyst will often facilitate discussions with stakeholders in order to detail out user stories that may identify new or changes to systems, processes or procedures, and may assist with the planning and development of training materials to ensure adoption. The Business Analyst may also be called upon to perform testing duties within their assigned team and may also be asked to perform system administration duties for assigned configurable enterprise systems.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

1. Work with the team and the Product Owner in the grooming of the team’s backlog
2. Work with team members, Product Owner(s) and/or stakeholders to break down and detail user stories, in order to establish clear and testable requirements within the user story

3. Responsible for the creation of and maintenance of process flows related to their assigned function

4. Ability to work cross-functionally within their assigned team, requiring a close working relationship with all members of the team

5. Complete Business Case Analyses and aid in researching possible solutions

6. Lead or assist in Request for Information and/or Request for Proposal activities to identify and select the best software solution and vendor to address identified business needs

7. Perform ongoing system administration duties for assigned configurable enterprise systems to document, update and maintain them to keep them current

8. Performs other functions as assigned
TYPICAL EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:
1. BA/BS degree, with emphasis on business and lending processes, working understanding of information systems; or equivalent.
2. At least five years of related experience with demonstrated proficiency in lending practices and familiarity with information system development and support. Familiarity with typical programming languages is desirable.
3. Familiarity with banking accounting systems (i.e. payment processing, billing, etc.)
4. Familiarity with Agile principles.
5. Thorough knowledge of word processing and data analysis software such as Microsoft Word, Excel and/or Access is required; Thorough knowledge of presentation software such as MS PowerPoint and Visio required.
6. Working knowledge of Business Analysis roles, responsibilities and activities and System Development Life Cycle methodologies.
7. Familiarity with industry best practices in the areas of data integrity controls and testing
8. Strong analytical and problem solving skills.
9. Strong organizational and time management skills.
10. Excellent interpersonal skills including strong meeting facilitation, verbal, written skills.
11. Travel required in performance of job.
JOB REQUIREMENTS:
All hiring is contingent on eligibility to work in the United States. We are unable to sponsor or transfer visas for applicants.

Must have the ability to perform basic office tasks and sit at a desk for an extended period of time. Job requires extensive use of computers and phones. While performing the job, the employee is required to sit, crouch, kneel, crawl, reach and have the ability to lift up to 40 pounds. Ability to work with typical hardware and cabling practices required. Must have strong written and verbal communication skills to adequately convey ideas and work well with a team. Ability to talk and hear, sit and use their hands and fingers, and reach in all directions is essential in performance of the job. Must be able to interact effectively with people at all levels of company. Work during established business hours and may require occasional weekend and/or evening work.

EOE/AA/M/F/D/V

FullDescriptions:
Frontier Airlines is committed to offering ‘Low Fares Done Right’ to more than 80 destinations in the United States, Canada, Dominican Republic and Mexico on more than 300 daily flights. Headquartered in Denver, Frontier’s hard-working aviation professionals pride themselves in delivering the company’s signature Rocky Mountain hospitality to customers. Frontier Airlines is the proud recipient of the Federal Aviation Administration’s 2016 Diamond Award for maintenance excellence and was recently named the industry’s most fuel-efficient airline by The International Council on Clean Transportation (ICCT) as a result of superior technology and operational efficiencies.
The Senior data analyst will develop analytical tools and statistical models to present/enhance financial presentation. The position will be responsible for building data pipelines & coding automated reporting processes, creating data visualizations and dashboards, identifying and quantifying various process and financial opportunities, while crafting clear presentations to management. This role will continue to evolve and grow. During the growth of the position it will receive high visibility by senior management and enjoy a range of formal training and informal learning opportunities to support ongoing professional development and career growth.

Work with a wide variety of teams with diverse technical backgrounds

Create data pipelines to transform raw input into clean datasets for use in analysis
Write clean, efficient code to automate processes
Mentor more junior team members, and foster the development of their programming and analytics skills
Collaborate with diverse teams across the company
Conduct ad-hoc projects, reports and analyses as determined by management
Set the standard for the broader team in thought processes and analytical output
Clearly communicate the actionable business implications of complex quantitative analyses to senior management
Lead change across the organization thru process improvements and taking initiative to champion cross-functional opportunities
Job Requirements:
Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Computer Science, Mathematics, Finance, Aviation Management or related analytical field strongly preferred; combination of education and work experience considered in lieu of degree.
Master’s degree in a quantitative discipline will be considered with reduced years of experience
Minimum 4 years of experience in data analytics, business intelligence, operations research, finance, or a similar analytical field
Previous experience with data languages such as R script, Python, SQL, Hadoop, etc preferred

Ability to write SQL code including a good understanding of some of the more complex logic statements
Previous experience with Power BI and Tableau
Strong organizational skills, team attitude, etc
Ability to independently prioritize analyses in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
Ability to structure logical analytical approaches and to apply a range of quantitative techniques to solve business problems in an efficient, timely manner
Comfortable working self-sufficiently to creatively solve analytical challenges with limited data and imminent deadlines
Strong work ethic; delivers results in ambiguous, time-pressured situations
Sound judgment and ability to maintain composure under pressure

Reach Your Peak at Vail Resorts. You're someone who pushes boundaries and challenges the status quo. You're brave, ambitious and passionate in everything you do. And we want you on our team. SUMMARY OF JOB:

The HR Cloud Application Business Analyst is responsible for supporting the implementation and administration of our key HR cloud applications. These include:
Learning Management System (Saba), primarily in support of Talent Development, Compliance, Health & Safety and other company directives and/or trainings
HR Service Delivery and Knowledgebase Platform (ServiceNow), primarily in support of HR Services and the associated HR Centers of Excellence (Payroll, Benefits, Employee Relations, etc.)

Employee-facing Digital App and website (Modo), primarily in support of our employee population and the various resort locations

Configure changes to LMS Course structure or learning platform, including but not limited to updating facilities, locations, rooms or adding new activities

Generate, update and manage product content and information for the digital app

Bachelor’s Degree required
2 years of Cloud system support preferred

Title: Data Analyst

Position: Data Analyst

We’re looking for an experienced Data Analyst to assist various JumpCloud teams and help shape the company’s strategy around data. You’ll be leading the design and development of key metrics that inform strategic decision-making. The Data Analytics team focuses on providing business insights to each of the internal JumpCloud teams. Come be a part of an exciting new team where you will be able to help shape the company strategy around data.

Title: Research Instructor
Qualifications:
An MS in biostatistics, bioinformatics, computer science, mathematics, computational biology, or a related field
Strong programming skills in a common statistical software package (e.g. SAS, R).
Strong programming skills in multiple languages including several of Java, C++, Scala, R, Perl, Python, Bash, C, or others
At least 3 years of experience as an analytic consultant/collaborator.
Evidence of independence/leadership on research teams.
FullDescriptions:
University of Colorado Denver l Anschutz Medical Campus
School of Medicine, Department of Surgery – Division of GI, Trauma, and Endocrine Surgery
Research Instructor
Position #00757248

The University of Colorado Denver l Anschutz Medical Campus seeks individuals with demonstrated commitment to creating an inclusive learning and working environment. We value the ability to engage effectively with students, faculty and staff of diverse backgrounds.


The University of Colorado Denver | Anschutz Medical Campus is a public research university serving more than 18,000 students. We award nearly 4,000 degrees each year, including more graduate and professional degrees than any other Colorado institution. With our solid academic reputation, award-winning faculty and renowned researchers, we offer more than 140 highly rated degree programs through 13 schools and colleges. The university receives over $400 million in research awards each year. In addition to the wide array of health-related programs and facilities offered at CU Anschutz in Aurora, Colo. a significant number of undergraduate and graduate degree programs are taught at CU Denver, our comprehensive campus in the heart of downtown Denver—one of America’s most vibrant urban centers. CU Denver is located steps from the Denver Center for Performing Arts and the LoDo District affording our students, faculty and staff access to a broad array of academic, professional, community, recreational and cultural outlets.

A national leader in health care and life sciences, CU Anschutz is the only comprehensive academic health sciences center in Colorado and the largest in the Rocky Mountain region. Located in Aurora, Colo., it is one of the newest education, research and patient care facilities in the world. With six schools and colleges, CU Anschutz trains the health sciences workforce of the future by blending education, research and clinical care all in one place. This strategic collaboration among diverse health care fields allows knowledge to travel directly from the research bench to the patient’s bedside. Read CU Anschutz Quick Facts here.

Position Emphasis:
This is a Health Services Research position in the Department of Surgery. The primary project will be independent analysis of the At-Risk Intervention and Mentoring (AIM) program at Denver Health, a hospital-based violence intervention program. The position will involve some data collection through interviewing patients, along with research design and analysis of collected data, and independent, unbiased assessment of program endpoints and effectiveness. The University of Colorado Denver will complete research within the Design and Implementation Research Framework to allow for iterative changes of the program based on this feedback, as well as providing reports to the Department of Justice as may be required.

This research instructor is expected to provide high-level, professional and scientifically rigorous design and analysis support. The research instructor will be expected to work independently with research groups and mentor and supervise more junior analysts, data managers, and medical students. They will serve as lead biostatistician and exhibit their team science contributions through submission of applied abstracts and perhaps lead on collaborative publications. The research instructor in this position will consult and collaborate with investigators on all aspects of the research process, including: design of new studies (sample size and analysis planning), data management, data pre-processing, complex programming, analysis implementation and data visualization, and dissemination of results. This individual is expected to co-author abstracts, oral and poster presentations, and scientific manuscripts. Experience with qualitative analysis and mixed-methods analysis is preferred.

Supervision Received:
The Research Instructor position will be supervised by the Research Director.

Supervision Exercised:
The Research Instructor may have supervisory responsibilities with graduate students, Professional Research Assistants (PRA), medical students, and residents.

Examples of Work Performed:
Patient interviews, analysis of program endpoints, design and implementation frameworks. Initially more data collection, progressing to increased responsibilities and supervision of PRAs as the program grows.

Salary and Benefits:
Salary is commensurate with skills and experience. The University of Colorado offers a full benefits package. Information on University benefits programs, including eligibility, is located at Employee Services.

The University of Colorado Denver is dedicated to ensuring a safe and secure environment for our faculty, staff, students and visitors. To assist in achieving that goal, we conduct background investigations for all prospective employees.
The Immigration Reform and Control Act requires that verification of employment eligibility be documented for all new employees by the end of the third day of work. Alternative formats of this ad are available upon request for persons with disabilities.
Your total compensation goes beyond the number on your paycheck. The University of Colorado provides generous leave, health plans and retirement contributions that add to your bottom line.

Benefits: https://www.cu.edu/employee-services/benefits.

Total Compensation Calculator: https://www.cu.edu/employee-services/total-compensation

Diversity and Equity:
Please click here for information on disability accommodations: http://www.ucdenver.edu/about/departments/HR/jobs/Pages/JobsatCUDenver.aspx

The University of Colorado Denver | Anschutz Medical Campus is committed to recruiting and supporting a diverse student body, faculty and administrative staff. The university strives to promote a culture of inclusiveness, respect, communication and understanding. We encourage applications from women, ethnic minorities, persons with disabilities and all veterans. The University of Colorado is committed to diversity and equality in education and employment.

Qualifications

Minimum Qualifications:
An MS in biostatistics, bioinformatics, computer science, mathematics, computational biology, or a related field
Strong programming skills in a common statistical software package (e.g. SAS, R).
Strong programming skills in multiple languages including several of Java, C++, Scala, R, Perl, Python, Bash, C, or others
At least 3 years of experience as an analytic consultant/collaborator.
Evidence of independence/leadership on research teams.
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with data management and integration of data sources.
Experience writing reproducible data processing pipelines.
4+ years of post-graduate research experience as an analyst.
Experience serving as a data analyst or computational biologist on multiple projects.
Or equivalent combination of education, training, and experience that provides the individual with the required knowledge, skills and abilities.
Competencies:
Strong knowledge of statistical and/or computational biology principles relevant in medical research.
Ability to analyze and solve complex problems and apply quantitative analytical approaches.
Ability to investigate the properties of statistical/computational methodology through simulation or other means.
Strong programming skills in multiple languages including several of Java, C++, Scala, R, Perl, Python, Bash, C, or others
Strong programming skills in a common statistical software package (such as SAS, R).
An ability to work with high performance computing environments and cloud computing.
Good organizational skills across multiple projects, managing own work load, self-directed.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Positive attitude and the ability to work with a variety of biomedical investigators and colleagues.
Ability to contribute to the growth and development of Health Services Research in the Department of Surgery.
Demonstrated ability to successfully contribute to the analytic elements of multiple projects simultaneously.


Special Instructions to Applicants: Applications are accepted electronically ONLY at www.cu.edu/cu-careers. Review of applications will begin immediately, and will continue until the position is filled.


Application Materials Required: Cover Letter, Resume/CV, List of References

Application Materials Instructions: To apply, please visit: http://www.cu.edu/cu-careers and attach: 1. Title: Business Intelligence Reporting Analyst
Qualifications:
Seeking 3-5+ years of experience with business intelligence/analytic tools
Experience with Financial Management, Supply Chain, Warehouse Management, and Manufacturing
Fluent in at least SQL syntax (Read functions)
Experience with Tableau, Power BI, or Looker (or other data visualization tools)

Experience with eCommerce analysis (CLV, AOV, Retention Rate, etc) a plus
Experience with Python, Javascript, and R are a plus
Experience working with an eCommerce platform

Excellent planning and project management skills
Self-starter with a high level of initiative and strong sense of ownership
Strong communication and interpersonal skills
Experience working in the CPG industry preferred
Experience with both B2C and B2B business models preferred
FullDescriptions:
About Charlotte's Web™:
Charlotte's Web™ products are made from our world-renowned hemp genetics grown 100% in the USA. Founded by the Stanley Brothers of Colorado, Charlotte’s Web™ leads the industry in quality, safety, consistency and social responsibility to improve thousands of lives daily through the use of Charlotte's Web™. At Charlotte’s Web™, we are driven by principles that extend far beyond the bottom line. It is our goal to provide products of the highest possible quality, while contributing to the sustainability of the communities we have the privilege of serving.
Position Summary:
The Business Intelligence Reporting Analyst will be responsible for managing, developing, and maintaining corporate reporting and dashboards to help drive decision support for all functional business units.

Essential Duties:
Produce accurate, consistent and timely reporting by developing corporate level reports and dashboards
Communicate and distribute reports and dashboards via report subscriptions, PDF emails and slack messages, and interactive dashboards
Train functional teams on adoption and use of corporate reports and dashboards
Work with other departments to scope, plan, and develop automated reports
Maintain inventory of standard / corporate reports
Collaborate on technical requirements with IT
Work with the Business Intelligence Manager to interface with the business to establish needs and reporting standards
Develop and implement data reporting / analytic systems and other tactics that optimize information flow and insights
Establish phased reporting roadmaps that meet immediate and longer-term needs of business functions
Collaborate with the Business Intelligence Data Analyst on iterating dashboards to include the most current analytical angles
Be the “walking data dictionary”, knowing exactly where reported data comes from and what it means – be able to communicate these definitions to analysts and executives with the appropriate level of detail
Ensure that all related documentation (business requirements, technical designs, data dictionary, etc.) are created, maintained, and available in a central repository
Coordinate cross-functionally with other departmental managers and Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) in Accounting / Finance, Marketing, Ecommerce, Sales, Supply Chain, Manufacturing, and Cultivation
Support corporate objectives and global growth strategies
Provide recommendations for improvements
Escalate support issues to third-parties, as needed
Provide regular project status reports
Predict project risk factors and address proactively
Qualifications:
Seeking 3-5+ years of experience with business intelligence/analytic tools
Experience with Financial Management, Supply Chain, Warehouse Management, and Manufacturing
Fluent in at least SQL syntax (Read functions)
Experience with Tableau, Power BI, or Looker (or other data visualization tools)
Proficiency with MS Excel
Experience with statistical models and methodologies
Experience with eCommerce analysis (CLV, AOV, Retention Rate, etc) a plus
Experience with Python, Javascript, and R are a plus
Experience working with an eCommerce platform
Bachelor’s Degree in Information Technology or Mathematics or Statistics, or related field preferred
Excellent planning and project management skills
Self-starter with a high level of initiative and strong sense of ownership
Strong communication and interpersonal skills
Experience working in the CPG industry preferred
Experience with both B2C and B2B business models preferred

Benefits: We offer best-in-class benefits, including:
Company-Paid Medical, Dental, and Vision
3 Weeks of Paid Vacation Your First Year
401K Match with Automatic Vesting
Up to 9 Weeks Paid Parental Leave
Self-Tailored Wellness Program
Generous Employee Discount

This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training. Charlotte’s Web™ is an At-Will Employer.

Title: Financial Treasury Data Analyst
FullDescriptions:
Prologis is the global leader in logistics real estate. We own, manage and develop high-quality properties in the world’s most vibrant centers of commerce, approximately 771 million square feet in 19 countries. Some of the world’s largest brands (e.g., Amazon, BMW, DHL, FedEx, Pepsi) turn to us because they know an efficient supply chain will make their businesses run better, and a strategic relationship with Prologis will create competitive advantage. As the top ranked U.S. company and sixth overall among the Global 100 Most Sustainable Corporations in the World, we take our global footprint seriously.
Job Title:
Financial Treasury Data Analyst
Company:
Prologis
Do you want to play a role in global commerce?
The successful candidate will work in a dynamic finance department to support cash management activities of Prologis. The candidate will learn and conduct daily cash management activities, including payments and global cash reporting, conducted by the corporate Treasury department. In addition, the candidate will help the department re-engineer global cash reporting and cash forecasting processes.
What’s needed in order to do that:
Assist with developing and maintaining cash forecasts
Work collaboratively with teams around the world to deliver solutions that work and solve our real-world problems
Assist in roll out of Tableau BI reporting Platform, AI Initiatives and other Data Analytics
Analyze and interpret data from different sources and present recommendations for technical solutions and automation
Create new reporting metrics and requirements through the use of dashboards and KPI’s, etc. (in Tableau) as defined by the corporate Treasury department
Build knowledge about Treasury cash management operations
Tell us if you’re ready:
Education: Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Finance, Data Analytics or IT
1-2 years of full-time or combined internship experience required in a data-focused role
Demonstrated working experience with Business Intelligence tools (Tableau/BI), data management tools (SQL, Python) required
Strong Excel & PowerPoint skills; Visio a plus
Exceptional initiative and follow-through on projects
Track record of successful project management capabilities and commitment to clearly setting and accomplishing project deliverables
Build cooperative relationships with co-workers, managers and supervisors in a global team
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present your ideas clearly to decision-makers
Please note, in addition to a background and drug screening, this role will also require a credit check for the selected candidate.
People First
Each of us working at Prologis plays an essential role in the enduring success of our company. We value people who are decisive, courageous and adaptable. While we are one company, locations and departments operate with autonomy and accountability. Individuals take the initiative here.
When you join Prologis, you work shoulder to shoulder with some of the top talent in the industry to do the best work of your career. Every employee belongs. Every employee contributes. Employees advance their careers here.
As a successful global enterprise, Prologis has never lost sight of what matters most, our strong belief that our people are the most important part of our business. And because of that, we provide a generous total rewards package and take a lot of time to focus on quality management and leadership development. People come first here.
All job offers are contingent upon successful completion of drug screen and background verification. Prologis is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religions, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Title: Application Systems Analyst
Qualifications:
Qualified by experience in IT/ERP
Finance knowledge desirable
Skills:
Strong ERP skills and understanding of work streams.
Finance expertise preferred including (Reporting (Business World Excelerator, Balance tables, Views), Financials, AP, AR, Logistics, Project Management, Planner, Commitment Accounting)
Corporate Performance Management (CPM) system experience desirable
FullDescriptions:
Come join the world’s largest independent renewable energy company active in wind, solar, energy storage and transmission and distribution. Our vision is to be a leader in the transition where everyone has access to affordable zero carbon energy. Being part of the RES team means shaping the world’s energy future.

RES offers a comprehensive benefits package, including medical, dental, vision, 401K + employer match, life insurance and AD&D, paid time off, paid sabbatical, paid parental leave, alternative work schedules, fitness center membership, tuition reimbursement, and professional development.
Summary:
The Application Systems Analyst participates in the technical support, maintenance and performance management of the Corporate ERP software. This resource provides tier 2&3 support and development leadership on ERP & Finance projects within the global group while the focus is on the RES Americas business. This role provides comprehensive administration and support of core applications. In addition, this role will focus on the identifying, documentation and solutioning of the technical requirements of the RESA Finance customers. The role will identify and recommend creative solutions that will assist in improving existing processes and procedures to optimize the configuration and efficiency of the ERP system. Primary support focus will be for the Finance & Accounting Business Unit.

Specific duties:

Strong ERP skills including SAGE CRE300 and Business World On! Modules 6 & 7 preferred.
Business analysis with a key objective of aligning functional information systems with approved business process.
Drive efficiencies through simplification and standardization of processes and reporting.
Consider global alignment first, while supporting specific regional demands
Play a key part in the technical maintenance, development and implementation of Business World On! (Agresso), Prevero (CPM) and other information/finance systems.
Manage Tier 2&3 support for daily maintenance / administration of applications.
Work closely and build working relationships with other members of the Finance organisation.
Development, evaluation, implementation and documentation of technical solutions in consultation with the Senior IS Manager and key stakeholders.
Participate in transition to RUN support for new projects.
Implement small/medium changes in the existing systems.
Communicate with key stakeholders and analysts to identify new requirements and propose solutions.
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE

Strong ERP skills and understanding of work streams.
Finance expertise preferred including (Reporting (Business World Excelerator, Balance tables, Views), Financials, AP, AR, Logistics, Project Management, Planner, Commitment Accounting)
Corporate Performance Management (CPM) system experience desirable
REQUIRED SKILLS

Excellent written and oral communication skills
ITIL process knowledge and implementation experience
Problem solving
Adaptable
Self-motivated & managed team player
Strong MS SQL preferred (Oracle SQL accepted)
Strong Excel VBA/Macro (Desirable)
REQUIRED EXPERIENCE

Demonstrated ability to take the initiative and think creatively
Ability to interact successfully with people in a customer-facing role
Proven experience with ERP information systems
Ability to work independently
Strong experience in SQL
Understanding of Finance reporting, KPI’s and structures
Qualifications:

Qualified by experience in IT/ERP
Finance knowledge desirable
Physical requirements and environment:

The work environment and physical demands characteristics are representative of those the employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Performs primarily sedentary office duties with occasional travel to other Company offices or construction sites. Incumbent may occasionally lift up to 25 pounds and may be required to sit, stand, walk and use a computer.

We maintain a drug-free workplace. Candidates will be required to pass a pre-employment background investigation and drug test as a condition of employment.

Title: Full Stack Software Engineer
FullDescriptions:
Position: Full Stack Software Engineer

JumpCloud is looking for a talented Full Stack Software Engineer to join the Growth Engineering Team. This unique, cross-functional team is comprised of Marketing, Product, UX, and Engineering team members. The team’s mission is to accelerate JumpCloud’s growth by increasing conversions from free account signup all the way through revenue generation.

What you’ll be doing:
You’ll have the opportunity to learn and work in the entire tech stack of our new user onboarding in the product from the frontend user experience to the core backend services. You’ll leverage (and enhance) both our usage analytics to better understand how our prospective customers find success and our experimentation platform to test out ideas for how prospects can find success with our product more quickly. The team has the autonomy to generate and test ideas, and when there’s a winning idea, you’ll “productize” it.

We’re looking for…
2+ years of industry/production programming experience
Bachelor’s and/or Master’s degree, preferably in CS, or equivalent experience
Passion for delivering products end-to-end, from ideation through planning and scoping to implementation and experimental A/B testing
Experience in any of the following: Golang, NodeJS, Vue.js or software development experience in a variety of languages (Java, JavaScript, Python, C, or C++) with a strong desire to learn Golang, NodeJS, or Vue.js.
Experience developing large-scale web applications, SaaS applications in the cloud (AWS a plus) or large, distributed systems.
Experience or desire to work collaboratively in cross-functional teams with marketing, design, product, data analyst, and research partners.
Independent, dedicated, and able to deliver production ready code with minimal guidance.
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, a relevant field of engineering, or a closely related field.


Bonus points:
You’re picky about CSS
Database experience, including relational and non-relational databases
Experience in diving into user behavior metrics
Familiarity with A/B testing techniques

Title: Lead Data Analyst
Qualifications: A Strong foundation in using statistical and data visualization tools (e.g. SPSS, r. Tableau, Python, Oracle, Hadoop, etc.)Advance experience with Microsoft Access, PowerPoint, and Excel
FullDescriptions:
The HR Analytics, Lead Data Analyst has responsibility for analytics, analysis, data, non- standard reporting, and metrics within a designated business group at CenturyLink. This role will compile and analyze data to provide decision support to help drive the business on topics such as operations, cash flow, headcount, workforce planning, development, engagement, cost management, and retention. The role will have accountability for supporting the design and development – and leading the interpretation of – workforce reports and dashboards, including identifying key trends, opportunities and problem areas.
Job Description
 Serve as the primary consultant for internal clients to design and support analytics, identify and perform statistical analyses, and make recommendations on complex business issues in partnership with functional leadership. Work with stakeholders to understand business objectives to design analytic models to provide data insights to best support data-driven business decisions helping to maximize our investment in people. Gather and analyze data, using advanced statistical and predictive models to identify trends and root cause of problems to recommend headcount, assist in workforce planning, predict turnover, improve hiring and marketing, and other important business issues. Use technology, analytical, and quantitative research tools and models to develop and analyze cross-functional data as needed. Process large amounts of text-based data using software and statistical tools.
 Present methodology and conclusions of analyses to a variety of recipients including peers, management, and senior executive teams. Take the results of analyses and tell a story with the data to guide leaders in business decisions with the ability to explain details and high-level overviews depending on the audience.
 Collaborate with subject matter experts to promote data standards, quality, and governance to improve overall strategic and operational performance and insight. Partner with the Reporting Organization to design, develop, and generate non-standard reports, scorecards and dashboards. Analyze the data to ensure accuracy and that the content meets business needs and requirements.
 Utilize project management skills and indirect leadership skills to facilitate projects. May serve as a project manager or project workstream lead on multiple projects, initiatives, or studies. Produce clear, concise reports and/or presentations to communicate stats, risks and key updates.
Qualifications
A Strong foundation in using statistical and data visualization tools (e.g. SPSS, r. Tableau, Python, Oracle, Hadoop, etc.)Advance experience with Microsoft Access, PowerPoint, and Excel
Strong analytical execution with thoroughness, accuracy, and focus on data integrityStrong database management skills including the ability to merge, clean and analyze large amounts of dataEffective written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to explain data and findings to a non-technical audience
Excellent executive presentation skills: ability to extract, analyze and present actionable information from complex research
Identify risks and opportunities, brainstorm innovative solutions, and drive actions to quick resolution
Think strategically, persuade stakeholders, and execute methodically and autonomouslyStrong relationship building skills with internal/external partnersExperience working at a large, matrixed organization is highly preferredAbility to multitask and manage competing priorities6+ years related experience with Bachelors4+ years related experience with Masters

Education

Masters or Equivalent

Bachelors or Equivalent

Title: Junior Data Analyst
FullDescriptions:
We’re looking for an entry to mid-level analytics professional to support day-to-day responsibilities of our Analytics Team. Analytics is a cross functional team that collaborates with engineering, operations, risk management, and sales. The team leads large ambitious initiatives, interacts with our executive team on a regular basis, and develops strategic data-driven frameworks for all business areas. Our team is growing, and we are looking for smart people who love data and want to make a big impact at a cutting edge FinTech start-up. If you’re analytical, curious, and can communicate complex ideas simply, then we would love to talk to you.
Here’s what the day-to-day looks like:
Design, create, and analyze reports regarding credit underwriting, loan pricing, collections, and sales.
Be involved in metric development and perform various ad-hoc analyses.
Evaluate and analyze datasets for completeness and accuracy.
Review internally developed and third-party generic statistical models and scorecards.
Assist in the overall ongoing maintenance and monitoring of active models.
Partner with operations, risk management, and engineering to help shape the business objectively through data.
Do deep-dive analysis to uncover business insights to drive growth.
Automate various processes supporting internal and external analytics.
Here’s what we’re looking for:
2-3+ years of analytical experience, ideally in business intelligence, business operations, risk analysis or consulting.Experience at a fast-paced technology company preferred.Extensive experience with Excel, a proven mastery of Pivot Tables.Bachelor's degree required, in a major requiring rigorous quantitative focus (Social Sciences, Economics, Statistics, Actuarial Sciences, Computer Science, Operations Management, Information Systems, Mathematics, Business Administration or other quantitative, business or technical discipline).Fast learner who adapts well to a fast-moving production environment.Demonstrated experience building and maintaining data pipelines with SQL or similar cloud-based solution.Hands on mentality and customer centric mind-set, demonstrated ability as a self-starter.A humble approach to collaboration and teamwork.Strong organizational skills with the ability to work independently on multiple projects/tasks simultaneously.Previous experience with business intelligence software or ERPs (Tableau, Power BI, DOMO, Looker, etc.).Experience or interest in statistical programming languages (R / R Studio, Python) and applying machine learning algorithms in production.Experience with general scripting languages (e.g. Python).Experience with API documentation and development.

Title: Sr. Reporting and Systems Analyst
FullDescriptions:
Paladina Health is a growing healthcare start-up headquartered in downtown Denver. We have a vision to transform healthcare in America through primary care and are on an exciting path with $165 million recently raised to fuel and accelerate our growth!

Analytics plays an integral role at Paladina Health to support healthcare delivery and business operations by providing relevant, timely, and actionable insights to care teams and teammates – helping them make better, more informed decisions. This is accomplished by applying advanced analytic techniques to large integrated datasets and rendering outputs to users through data visualization tools. The candidate will be joining an innovative team that is passionate about using advanced analytics to improve healthcare outcomes.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

The following duties and responsibilities generally reflect the expectations of this position but are not intended to be all-inclusive.

Collaborates with a variety of individuals and department teams to provide comprehensive analyses for client and clinical reporting, and on organizational wide initiatives. Works directly with requestors to ensure best practices for data reporting.
Prepares, analyzes, and develops reports using Tableau. Develops regularly scheduled and ad hoc reports for end users and data quality management.
Involved in the development, preparation and outcome tracking for clinical and operational performance metrics.
Acts as liaison between IT teams and business stakeholders and end users.
Identifies data sources needed to produce required data sets or reports. Ensures delivered data solutions meet requirements. Collaborates with others to solve problems and obtain feedback on reports
Ability to oversee a report intake process; report requirements definition; report design, build, and maintenance; report deployment and training.
QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS

Education, licenses, certifications, and experience required to fulfill the essential duties, including computer skills as required.

3+ years of experience in a Healthcare industry in a data analyst or developer role
Strong proficiency in SQL.
Strong experience in developing and deploying reports using Tableau
Spotfire and SAS reporting a plus.
Experience in ETL/ELT development and methodology
Familiarity with healthcare eligibility, claims, pharmacy, clinical and other data sources.
Strong business analysis skills.
Knowledge of eClinicalWorks EMR and Salesforce data models are a plus.
Experience with data quality and data cleansing techniques.
Ability to communicate effectively and approach problems Primary point of contact proactively.
Strong Analytical Skills.
Very strong technical foundation and the ability to collaborate well with others.
Well organized, with a strong desire to document accurately.
High-energy, self-motivated, creative report developer.
Strong ability to solve business problems through creative and analytical logic.

A strategic and innovative thinker who is agile and possesses business-focused mindset.
4+years with SQL and database skills in SQL.
Strong Google suite skills – Docs, Sheets, Slides, etc.

Experience in analyzing data and providing recommendations; ability to train and mentor junior members on the team is a strong plus.

Provide analytical support for strategy development, measurement design, and post-campaign analysis.

Work with unstructured data sets and cleanse that data to make recommendations, using various tools like Redshift, Teradata, Tableau, and SQL server.#LI-JS1

Experience in analyzing data and providing recommendations; ability to train and mentor junior members on the team is a strong plus.
BS, BA or equivalent in Economics, Statistics, Math, Computer Science or related fields required; MBA or MS in Statistics, Math or related fields a plus; or combination of education and relevant work experience
The Marketing Data Analyst Lead will have a direct impact on growing the Sling business. Including helping us optimize performance in current Sling subscriber acquisitions and in supporting marketing, programming, and the digital team as Sling continues to drive the future of entertainment and interactivity. We’re looking for those with the capability and desire to position themselves and the Sling business for rapid growth.

The position will focus on producing accurate, practical insights that improve our effectiveness in acquiring and retaining the right consumers. The role will utilize data to track leads, build reports, understand customers, perform early signal analysis, and more. The role will evolve to help automate these processes and to work closely with customer acquisition leads to create and manage strategies aimed at maximizing the effectiveness of marketing campaigns. Where it goes from there… you get to help us decide.

As part of the Finance, Strategy and Analytics team, the Marketing Data Analyst Lead will be responsible for building and maintaining reporting, analysis viewership and customer behaviors, evaluating product performance and make appropriate recommendations to programming, marketing, and digital teams. This includes using advanced statistical models, developing and maintaining analytic infrastructure, rigorous program analysis, creating and running advanced queries and reports, and performing customer analyses.

Responsibilities include:
Leverage SQL development skills to perform full-lifecycle data mining activities including requirements analysis, data quality assessment, data profiling, design and development of analytic data sets, data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) from both relational databases and flat-file sources.
Work with internal clients to understand requirements and potential uses for predictive models, descriptive models, and marketing reports.
Provide analytical support for strategy development, measurement design, and post-campaign analysis.
Provide support for ad-hoc analytical projects, including customer-level analysis, segmentation analysis, product affinity, and customer profiling analysis.
Work with unstructured data sets and cleanse that data to make recommendations, using various tools like Redshift, Teradata, Tableau, and SQL server.#LI-JS1
#LI-SLING1

Title: Database Analyst
FullDescriptions:
The mission of the Colorado Coalition for the Homeless is to work collaboratively toward the prevention of homelessness and the creation of lasting solutions for homeless and at-risk families, children, and individuals throughout Colorado. The Coalition advocates for and provides a continuum of housing and a variety of services to improve the health, well-being, and stability of those it serves.

The Colorado Coalition for the Homeless seeks a Database Analyst to be a part of a team of people who provide database and analytics support to users of the Electronic Health Record (EHR) and related applications and acts as a user resource to bridge the gap between data and clinical processes. Additional responsibilities include synthesizing complex or diverse information from multiple sources, conducting quantitative analyses, providing feedback regarding outcomes to program staff and funders, working with management and program teams to utilize data for quality improvement activities, and communicating complicated information to key stakeholders. This position will adhere to all Federal, State, and Local laws and regulations pertaining to the use of protected health information. This position is located at 2111 Champa Street, Denver, CO 80205 and reports to the Director of Applications Support.

Coalition Benefits

In addition to the unique challenges and extraordinary rewards of our work, eligible Coalition employees enjoy a rich benefits package, including:


Health insurance coverage on the first day of employment: full-time employees contribute only 1% of their earnings for their own health coverage and no more than 4% of their earnings for coverage of eligible dependents. We’re proud to offer same- and opposite-sex domestic partner coverage;
Dental, vision, and flexible spending/dependent care/public transit accounts;
Free basic life insurance and long-term disability coverage;
Dollar-for-dollar retirement plan matching contributions up to 5% of earnings;
Extensive paid time-off, including 8 holidays, 12 days of sick leave, and three weeks of vacation for new full-time employees in their first full year.

Essential Job Functions

1. Manages and maintain effective relationships with key stakeholders. Serve as liaison between EHR technical team, outcomes team, and clinic management.
2. Supports clinic staff efforts to serve patients and comply with funder requirements for specific grant reporting.
3. Collects, organizes, and interprets statistical information with computerized systems and complex calculation applications to make assumptions, develops trends analysis and draws conclusions, and educates leadership on how to use the information.
4. Works collaboratively with leadership to design and build the reports necessary to answer questions and achieve strategic goals.
5. Exhibits initiative to identify needed enhancements to current process flows and help to implement change, working independently and using sound judgment, escalating issues when appropriate.
6. Participates in ongoing decisions concerning data collection methods and data analysis; identifies, develops and proposes alternative data metrics.
7. Compiles data from multiple sources to support monitoring of social and health outcomes.
8. Conducts statistical tests for evaluation purposes, interprets results of both qualitative and quantitative analyses, and creates data visualizations detailing outcomes for presentations to management and staff.
9. Prepares regular reports to funders regarding progress toward outcomes.
10. Maintains a work environment that is marked by respect for others, values inclusiveness, builds workforce diversity, and fosters cooperation and teamwork.
11. Performs other duties as assigned by management.
Employee must be able to perform essential job functions with or without reasonable accommodation and without posing a direct threat to safety or health of self or others. To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential function satisfactorily. The requirements listed above are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Qualifications Summary

1. Bachelor's Degree in Data/Information Science, Computer Science or Healthcare Informatics required, equivalent experience or AHIMA Data Analyst Certification (CHDA) may substitute.
2. 3+ years of data analysis/statistical experience preferred.
3. Intermediate experience in database administration and reporting including Crystal Reports, Microsoft SQL Server, Microsoft Report Builder, and SSIS/SQL Data Tools.

The Colorado Coalition for the Homeless is committed to delivering services, making employment-related decisions, selecting volunteers, and selecting vendors without regard to age over 40, race, sex, color, religion, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, genetic information, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, pregnancy, medical condition related to pregnancy, military status, or any other applicable status protected by law.

MIRACORP Inc., is a veteran, women-owned firm specializing in federal government contract services. One of our competitive advantages is that we provide services to our customers with a standard of excellence that is unmatched. MIRACORP believes our employees are the cornerstone for our success.
