Title: Director of Finance and Administration
FullDescriptions:
About Kion
Our purpose is to empower people to live a joyful, adventurous, and fulfilling life. We are an eCommerce dietary supplement and functional food company. Our core values are integrity, joy, adventure, transparency, health, humility, gratitude, and authenticity.
Job Overview

We are looking for an excited and motivated leader to oversee the day-to-day finance, accounting, legal, insurance, office admin, HR, and IT operations in our fun and fast-paced company. This position will be responsible for company-wide budget planning; overall financial oversight and development; organizing, overseeing, and maintaining all legal contracts and relationships; oversight of office admin and HR staff; and oversight of IT infrastructure and data analysis staff and objectives.

The Right Fit

At Kion, we hire for culture first. Then ability. And then skills. Please consider the following when deciding if this opportunity is the right fit for you.

Culturally, we seek team members who are interested in:

Exercise
Nutrition
Meditation
Self-Reflection
Personal Growth
Humor
Fun
Adventure
We seek these core abilities and qualities for this specific role:

Excellent communication and organization skills
Excited about financial, legal, and administrative deep work
Strategic thinker with creative ideas for building out a department
Energized by the idea of leading and motivating a team
Excited about learning new systems and improving current standard operating procedures
Proven ability to project manage
Strong sense of follow-through and completing tasks
Ability to problem-solve
Adaptable personality
“Can do it, can figure it out” attitude
Wants to lead, and continue to develop and grow as a leader
Navigate conflict and resolution with grace, respect and accountability
As for skills, we are looking for someone who has experience working in a fast-paced environment and responding well to change and new ideas. You must already possess the following skills:

Developing and maintaining finance, legal, and administrative operational systems and processes
Financial reporting, budgeting, and statement analysis

Title: BI Analyst - SQL Development
FullDescriptions:
The Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst - SQL Development role within DaVita’s People (Human Resources or HR) Insights & Analytics team is designed to ensure integrity of compile complex data sets, produce an effective reporting environment, generate insight, and help draw conclusions and recommendations about DaVita’s business using DaVita’s people data. The role would have a focus on developing and maintaining our SQL database and Tableau tools, acting as a liaison between the People Insights & Analytics team and IT. The scope of work includes developing business intelligence, and empirically supported recommendations to leaders, in summary and executive ready formats. The successful candidate will also develop new analytical solutions, improve SQL/Tableau, and drive decisions around how DaVita quantifies and improves the teammate experience. This position reports to a manager on the People Insights & Analytics team.
Duties & Responsibilities
Develops, maintains and enhances the HR Analytics SQL Server database in SQL Server Management Studio, using Informatica workflows, and current and future direct access needs for customers via Tableau and other BI tools
Understands in depth the data, sources and reporting outputs need to ensure quality data
Acts as owner for database integrity, developing and maintaining a cohesive audit process
Collaborates with vendors and partners to structure and integrate outside data sources
Identifies opportunities to automate and streamline reports and BI tools, redesigns to include these efficiencies
Identify problems and propose potential analytical solutions
Make recommendations aligned with business goals and strategy
Participate and lead projects and programs with people data, prioritizing work based on changing demands
Create effective visualizations tailored to the context of the data and the audience
Proactively seek to improve processes and programs
Ensure the integrity of sensitive, confidential data
Proficiency in software tools like Excel, Workday (or other HRIS), SQL, and Tableau
Explain complex, technical issues in a simple, effective way
Proactively collaborate, guide, and provide expertise to internal business partners
Present to audiences at varied skill-levels, telling a story with the data
Build strong partnerships with stakeholders within and outside of the team
Other duties as assigned
Minimum Qualifications
Bachelor’s Degree required in business, economics, engineering, finance, mathematics, statistics, psychology, technology or other applicable quantitative or management related field.
1+ year in a business environment, gathering and using data to solve business problems. Management consulting or similar experience a plus.
2 years of experience in database querying and understanding of relational database design. Advanced SQL Server skills required. Workday preferred.
1 year or more of intermediate to advanced ETL development using Informatica required.
1 year of experience in building and maintaining Tableau.
Experience using working with multiple data sources to generate insights from analyses, answering questions, creating solutions, and manipulating large data sets to measure the effectiveness of projects, programs, and efforts for an organization.
Strong written and verbal communication skills; experience collaborating on project teams, managing relationships with clients, and presenting to audiences a plus.
Intermediate to advanced skills in Excel, Word, Outlook and PowerPoint required.
Human Resources experience preferred.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Responsibilities:
Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports
Proficiency with spreadsheet applications, including Excel.
Extrapolation of data patterns to derive meaningful results. Ability to create visualizations that clearly illustrate results for non-technical personnel
Ability to clearly communicate complex analysis to non-technical personnel both verbally and in written forms
Must display critical thinking skills, including the ability to assess numbers, trends, and data in order to reach new conclusions based on the findings
Develop and maintain and in-depth knowledge of the market segment, sharing insights, trends, benchmarking and best practices with clients assigned
Proactively assesses company performance on quality, calibration, round spread, day-parting, survey results, Specialist feedback and manages SLAs
Suggests new methods of data capture, analysis and reporting to provide continuous improvement and value to clients served
Able to interface closely with internal/external clients to identify the requirements for embedded Qlik reports
SQL database query capabilities
Qlik dashboard and reporting knowledge and skill
Proactively assesses, clarifies, validates customer needs and adds value to customers programs on an ongoing basis.
Establishes productive, professional and consultative relationships with key personnel throughout assigned client organizations (at both the franchise and corporate level).

FullDescriptions:
Overview
Senior Data Analyst

Steritech is the market leader in food safety, quality assurance, and customer experience management. We pride ourselves on being a trusted partner to many of the world’s leading brands across industries as diverse as manufacturing, processing, retail, food service, and hospitality. We help our clients give the best, safest, and healthiest possible service to THEIR customers.

Not to mention…
World-class training of the latest food safety and customer service best practices
Coaching/mentoring and career advancement opportunities
Great benefits - Medical, Dental, and Vision, Employer-matched 401(k)
Paid vacation, holidays, and PTO days

The Senior Data Analyst (SDA) is a position on the Analytics Team reporting to the Director, Insights & Analytics.
The Senior Data Analyst position has the following responsibilities included in the Data Analyst Position.
The DA has primary responsibility for analyzing client data for specific insights that will enable the client to make better business decisions.

Examples of these types of analyses include:
Evaluation of assessment results for predictive/prescriptive analytics,
Correlation of assessment results to outside data sources,
Comparison of assessment data to results from a given client’s peer group,
Analysis of factors associated with assessment results to determine specific relationships,
Monitoring Specialist metrics to advise the client team on potential concerns, and
Routinely advising on adherence to specific service level agreements.
 The DA role is client facing, and may require attendance and presentations at business reviews and other client or internal meetings in order to strengthen the relationship with the customer. The DA will work closely with the rest of the client team to ensure seamless communication and delivery of results.
In addition, the Data Analyst must develop an in-depth understanding of the Brand Standards business, Steritech protocols and procedures and specific customer brand requirements to ensure a high level of service to the client and to facilitate excellent communication between Steritech and all levels of the client organization.
Additionally the Senior Data Analyst role will have responsibility for the development of embedded Qlik reports for internal and external customers. This will include:
Working closely with internal/external customers to identify requirements
Writing SQL code for database queries
Developing the reports in Qlik
Embedding the reports in OnBrand
Testing/QA of reports
On-going maintenance of reports.
Responsibilities
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports
Proficiency with spreadsheet applications, including Excel.
Extrapolation of data patterns to derive meaningful results. Ability to create visualizations that clearly illustrate results for non-technical personnel
Ability to clearly communicate complex analysis to non-technical personnel both verbally and in written forms
Must display critical thinking skills, including the ability to assess numbers, trends, and data in order to reach new conclusions based on the findings
Develop and maintain and in-depth knowledge of the market segment, sharing insights, trends, benchmarking and best practices with clients assigned
Proactively assesses company performance on quality, calibration, round spread, day-parting, survey results, Specialist feedback and manages SLAs
Suggests new methods of data capture, analysis and reporting to provide continuous improvement and value to clients served
Able to interface closely with internal/external clients to identify the requirements for embedded Qlik reports
SQL database query capabilities
Qlik dashboard and reporting knowledge and skill
Proactively assesses, clarifies, validates customer needs and adds value to customers programs on an ongoing basis.
Establishes productive, professional and consultative relationships with key personnel throughout assigned client organizations (at both the franchise and corporate level).
Performs all other duties as assigned.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, ability and/or background required.
Must have a Bachelor’s Degree in data science or a related field or three years progressive experience in a data analysis role
Must be a self-starter with the ability to perform independently in high pressure and dynamic situations with skill and tact
Demonstrated ability to execute on projects and initiatives
Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written
Ability to demonstrate data analysis skill and ability to apply this to business situations
Attention to detail.
Sound decision making skills.
Desire and ability to travel via car and airplane to meet clients, field operations, attend meetings and conference as necessary (10% travel potential)
Proficiency with Google applications (docs, sheets, calendar, drive, etc.).
Must pass pre-employment background screenings (DMV, criminal, drug).

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Minimum two years of data analysis experience
Proficiency with Business Intelligence Tools such as Power BI, Tableau and QlikView
Experience in the (foodservice/grocery/convenience/QSR) industry

PHYSICAL DEMANDS

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential duties.
Passenger car, telephone, personal computer, other general office equipment
Walking, standing, squatting, kneeling, sitting, driving, seeing, communicating (orally & in writing).

Title: NOC Analyst
FullDescriptions:
Since 1975, MAXIMUS has operated under its founding mission of Helping Government Serve the People, enabling citizens around the globe to successfully engage with their governments at all levels and across a variety of health and human services programs. MAXIMUS delivers innovative business process management and technology solutions that contribute to improved outcomes for citizens and higher levels of productivity, accuracy, accountability and efficiency of government-sponsored programs. With more than 30,000 employees worldwide, MAXIMUS is a proud partner to government agencies in the United States, Australia, Canada, Saudi Arabia, Singapore and the United Kingdom. For more information, visit https://www.maximus.com.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Identify gaps in project and systems performance management processes.Create process documentation and training materials.Conduct reviews of data derived from project and systems performance management processes and summarize findings.Perform quality audit of work products delivered by team members and service providers.Create reports used to evaluate trends to support continuous improvement initiatives.Analyze data and report on issues and challenges related to the effective execution of project and performance management processes.Maintain knowledge library and documentation of system operation procedures.Conduct meetings and interviews with customers (internal and external) and team members to elicit business requirements and set achievable expectations.Analyze system data and performance reports to support identification of trends and business impact.Analyze information related to systems management activities (estimates, resources, time logs, risks, change requests, and schedules), and prepare actionable recommendations to support business objectives.Interact with all levels within the organization, develop working relationships with management, staff, stakeholders, and partners.Participate in client meetings to address needs of project stakeholders.Seek opportunities to add value to internal and external client initiatives.Manage the activities of the project in accordance with MAXIMUS established policies and procedures.Recommend changes to policies and establishes procedures.
Minimum Requirements:
Bachelor's degree with 3+ years of experience.May have additional training or education in area of specialization.Develops solutions to a variety of problems of moderate scope & complexity.General application of concepts & principles.Contributes to the completion of organizational projects & goals.Frequent use and general knowledge of industry practices, techniques, and standards.Applies knowledge and skills to complete a wide range of tasks.Communicates on complex or sensitive issues or drafts such responses for supervisor or manager.

EEO Statement: Active military service members, their spouses, and veteran candidates often embody the core competencies MAXIMUS deems essential, and bring a resiliency and dependability that greatly enhances our workforce. We recognize your unique skills and experiences, and want to provide you with a career path that allows you to continue making a difference for our country. We’re proud of our connections to organizations dedicated to serving veterans and their families. If you are transitioning from military to civilian life, have prior service, are a retired veteran or a member of the National Guard or Reserves, or a spouse of an active military service member, we have challenging and rewarding career opportunities available for you. A committed and diverse workforce is our most important resource. MAXIMUS is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer. MAXIMUS provides equal employment opportunities to all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status or disabled status.

Title: Business Analyst, Strategy and Operations (Hospital Services Group)
FullDescriptions:
GENERAL PURPOSE OF THE JOB
This position participates as a core member and contributor to the Hospital Services Group National Team, the growing team responsible for centrally supporting the Hospital Services Group Divisional Teams. This role involves providing quantitative and qualitative strategic and analytical support for the deployment of the Hospitals Without Walls (HWOW) program, a clinical and billing data capture application for DaVita’s 1m+ Acute treatments at 900+ hospitals.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES
Support data collection and analysis on timeline, training, and implementations of HWOW application
Identify DaVita hospitals eligible for application deployment
Estimate budgetary impact of application deployment
Support logistics for training and implementation
Support development of application requirements for additional releases
Coordinate field logistics with IT and deployment leadership
Establish and report on project dashboard and KPIs
Use data from all sources to complete analyses (i.e., Databases, Interviews, Research, etc.)
Summarize project insights/conclusions and identifies next steps through well-structured written and verbal communication
Stretch “up” and “down” in responsibilities
Collaborate with the team to overcome any organizational obstacles encountered
Collaborate with Teammates outside of HSG team to gather data and information
Conduct appropriate financial and statistical analysis to integrate new information
Provide recommendations to adjust plans and strategies accordingly
Structure analysis with relatively ambiguous data sets/problems
Perform additional tasks and projects as required
Travel required: 10-20%, Home Location: Denver
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s degree required
Preferred 1-3 years’ experience in consulting, investment banking, business/strategy planning or corporate finance
Solid understanding of business and strategy concepts
Strong attention to detail and comfort working with numbers
Comfort in a growing, shifting and ambiguous environment, with strong drive and self-direction
Interest in healthcare industry required, background in Healthcare, especially Hospitals preferred
Advanced computer skills and proficiency in MS Excel required; intermediate skills and proficiency in MS Word, Outlook, and PowerPoint required
Here is what you can expect when you join our Village:
A "Community first, Company second" culture based on Core Values that really matter.Clinical outcomes consistently ranked above the national average.Award-winning education and training across multiple career paths to help you reach your potential.Performance-based rewards based on stellar individual and team contributions.A comprehensive benefits package designed to enhance your health, your financial well-being and your future.Dedication, above all, to caring for patients suffering from chronic kidney failure around the world.Basic computer skills and proficiency in MS Word, Excel, and Outlook required
Join us as we pursue our vision "To Build the Greatest Healthcare Community the World has Ever Seen."

Why wait? Explore a career with DaVita today.

Go to http://careers.davita.com to learn more or apply.

FullDescriptions:
Job Description

Vertafore Professional Services Organization is looking for dynamic and passionate people to join our team! As a new Implementation Consultant, you will develop market leading skills that will launch your career growth aligned with your professional aspirations.
Vertafore Implementation Consultants succeed in meeting customer needs and solving problems with technology solutions. This role is part of a highly effective, fast-paced team who serve as the hub to deploy and execute system conversions as well as maintain over 150 different servers. They are trusted advisors combining project management, configuration, data conversion, training, and business expertise to guide our customers through the process of software implementation and achieve customer success.


Implementation Consultants start their journey with a cohort of colleagues that undergo robust training and with the opportunity to work across multiple Vertafore products and competencies. This is a hands-on position requiring strong technical acumen and non-standard hours. This role will execute data conversions and system migration deployments to production environments. They will manage a queue of ticketing requests and will thrive on completing each request accurately and timely.


If you want to solve difficult problems for industry leading companies in a wealthy market segment, then this is the job for you. You will be part of a strong Professional Services team that is here to support a career path that is aligned with your professional aspirations.


You will start your career in our Denver Delivery Center building skills and working in our high volume, SaaS based implementation practice. As you develop deeper industry, business, & competency expertise you will have the opportunity to grow into our enterprise implementation practices leading very large and complex customer engagements.
The right candidate will thrive on making everyone around them better, enthusiastically meet goals, and are motivated by team accomplishment over individual accolades.


Core requirements and responsibilities:
Essential job functions included but are not limited to the following:


Assist and guide customers through the conversion process to convert their source data to a Vertafore system
Assist Analysts and Project Managers with program/conversion issues troubleshooting and resolution and delegate to other developers as needed
Perform product installs and upgrades; database migrations and upgrades in production
Assist and direct customers in performing data translations and mappings
Document all discussions, issues and solutions to problems involving the customer in the customer relationship management system
Research/diagnose problems for prompt resolution to time sensitive issues
Perform quality assurance on all converted data for accuracy from application functionality perspective
Become a subject matter expert with our products, methodology, and P&C business operations
Work within and across teams implementing Vertafore products and delivering Professional Services
Communicate project deliverables at all levels, and make sure items are executed on time, to budget, with high quality
Provide complete and concise internal reporting for all engagements
Commit to improve existing skills, and develop new skills on an ongoing basis
Requires occasional weekend and after-hours availability for client support and conversion assistance
Lead workshops with client stakeholders to explain and decide upon key data conversion options and translations
Skills & Requirements
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
Self-starter, detail oriented, quick learner and deadline driven
Ability to quickly learn and understand new database schemas
Ability to create tables, views, stored procedures, indexes, constraints, cursors, triggers using either T-SQL or PL/SQL
Ability to work with variety of different file/data formats
Ability to analyze and manipulate large data sets in Excel
Passionate about continuously learning new technologies and skills.
Thrive in a challenging environment, helping users adopt new technology that impacts every element of their day to day work.
Strong interpersonal skills with the proven ability to effectively engage and influence at all levels, and ability to effectively handle crucial conversations and manage conflict resolution
Ability to effectively prioritize workload and tasks to meet deadlines
Outstanding time management skills
Ability to be creative and innovative
Flexible, easily adaptable to change
Take proactive approach towards continued improvement of internal documentation, tools and processes related to data conversion deliverables
Qualifications:
Undergraduate degree in engineering, business, math, computer science or related field preferred
Experience with SQL is highly desired, but not required
Experience in a high availability, scalable environment with large data volumes at multiple locations preferred
You aspire to be a dedicated contributor for providing technical support to teams and outstanding support to customers
Prior insurance industry experience and knowledge is a bonus
Additional Requirements and Details:
Travel required up to 25% of the time.
Located and working from an office location.
Occasional lifting and/or moving up to 10 pounds.
Frequent repetitive hand and arm movements required to operate a computer.
Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision (working on a computer, etc.).
Frequent sitting and/or standing.
Vertafore is a drug free workplace and conducts preemployment drug and background screenings.
The selected candidate must be legally authorized to work in the United States.
The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this job. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all the job responsibilities, duties, skill, or working conditions. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice. In addition, this document does not create an employment contract, implied or otherwise, other than an "at will" relationship.
Vertafore strongly supports equal employment opportunity for all applicants regardless of race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, pregnancy, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, marital status, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, sexual orientation, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by state or federal law.

Title: Associate Business Analyst
FullDescriptions:
JOB SUMMARY
This position will work as part of a team that is responsible for financial and business operations across the Technology Services organization. Primary responsibilities will include managing and tracking contract labor within the to-be-launched Fieldglass vendor management system, as well as overseeing all onboarding activities for new contractors and employees. Responsible for analyzing business operations and recommending solutions to align individual business functions with organizational goals. This role gains understanding of the structure, policies, and operations of an organization, and assists in recommending solutions to improve general business processes and planning. This position can collaborate with one or several business units or functions..

MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Under general supervision work with business stakeholders analyze business operations and recommend solutions to align individual business functions with organizational goals

Work on gaining understanding of the structure, policies, and operations of an organization, and assist in recommending solutions to improve general business processes and planning

Compile, analyze, interpret, and present data related to current and future operation

Create reports, charts, graphs and presentations to aid in proposing new strategies for successful business changes

Develop project estimates by identifying phases and elements, personnel requirements, and costs

Analyze external market dynamics and other data sources to assess trends and assist in developing actionable insights and recommendations to management, via understanding of the business model and the information available for analysis

May make recommendations for solutions or improvements that can be accomplished through new technology or alternative uses of existing technology

Perform other duties as requested

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
Skills/Abilities and Knowledge
Ability to read, write, speak and understand English
Ability to prioritize and organize effectively
Ability to work independently, as well as in a collaborative and dynamic team environment
Ability to handle multiple projects and priorities
Ability to analyze and interpret data
Ability to quickly identify business problems/opportunities
Ability to communicate orally and in writing in a clear and straightforward manner
Ability to communicate with all levels of management and company personnel
Ability to manage multiple projects at one time
Ability to prioritize and organize effectively

Title: Data Analyst/Modeler wanted in Broomfield, CO
FullDescriptions:
We are seeking Data Analyst/Modeler 12-month contract (potential to convert to perm) in Broomfield CO.
Description:

Develops SQL, data models, requirements documents, data analysis documents to meet the needs of the organization's data warehouse information systems.
Manages the flow of information between system and departments using relational and Hadoop databases.
Maintains data integrity by working to eliminate redundancy.
Works with the business to understand the business logic and translates logic into pseudo code/SQL.

Stays informed of the ways the organization uses its data.
Strong SQL skills desired.

Finance background desired, preferably in the billing area.
8+ years of experience needed.

If qualified, interested and available (or know of somebody who is), please reply back with an updated resume and rate for immediate consideration to anna.kaminsky@comcentric.com

Anna Kaminsky
Recruiter

Title: Data/System Analyst
FullDescriptions:
Raytheon IIS/GIS provides Operations and Maintenance support for the Intelligence Community

Job Description:

The SP Data Analyst (SPDA) will be required to perform operational mission analysis to maintain system connectivity. The SPDA will be required to conduct data analysis and system monitoring to ensure continuous system operations and uninterrupted data flow. The SPDA will be required to develop innovative troubleshooting techniques and operating procedures in a dynamic high ops-tempo work environment.

Required Skills:
Requires experience performing mission support in an operations environment.
Requires experience using multiple software applications simultaneously in an operating environment.
Must be willing to work 12-hour shifts (primarily swing/mid) rotating through days, nights, weekends, and holidays.
Requires US Citizenship.
Requires an active or current (active within the last five years) TS/SCI SSBI Security Clearance.
Requires ability to satisfy requirements for a TS/SCI SSBI security clearance.
Requires current CI Polygraph
Desired Skills:
At least experience in, or knowledge of, any/all of the following areas: web-based applications (to include CBET and GALE-Lite), near real-time operations, and the ability with other technical operations/maintenance personnel.
Strong communication skills and ability to work in a team environment.
Ability to communicate effectively with local management and remote personnel.
Ability to work in a high stress environment that demands foresight and strong technical skills.
Ability to work alone and take the initiative to solve problems.
Required Education (including Major):
8 years of requires related work experience in lieu of a Bachelor's degree.
148924
Raytheon is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

Title: Proprietary LNG Analyst
Skills:
Bachelor's Degree in a quantitative or business discipline (ie. Finance, Economics, Mathematics, Engineering, Geosciences, or a related field)
At least 1 year of related experience
FullDescriptions:
Genscape is the source of truth and insight for global energy markets and a pioneer in technological innovation. With the first ever power monitoring sensor capable of measuring real-time flow on power lines, Genscape changed the way the world sees and reacts to energy markets.

Today we are the leader in real-time data delivery and market intelligence. We operate the world's largest private network of in-field monitors and distribute industry-leading alternative data, delivering unsurpassed market intelligence across the commodity and energy spectrum including power, oil, natural gas, natural gas liquids, agriculture, biofuels, and maritime freight. Our spirit and culture continue to be the hallmark of what makes working at Genscape great.

Our LNG and Proprietary Natural Gas team is responsible for maintaining the day-to-day operations of Genscape's North American LNG data-sets, which consist of proprietary monitor/camera imagery, natural gas pipeline nominations data, ship tracking software, and primary research. The LNG Analyst will be responsible for the following duties:


Responsibility in maintaining the LNG products by ensuring timely and accurate assessment of camera observations; track inbound and outbound LNG vessels using our ship tracking data.
Maintain and organize primary research of existing and proposed LNG infrastructure.
Become an expert user of Genscape's LNG datasets and delivery platforms.
Utilize a combination of internal datasets and primary research to provide timely analysis regarding North American LNG facilities operations and insights to impacts on the broader natural gas market
Contribute to weekly LNG commentary and weekly internal market calls with the broader Genscape Natural Gas Team.
Interact and develop professional relationships with our client base answering questions in a timely manner; provide both data/product related troubleshooting support, as well as market research support.

Ideal candidate:

Highly detail oriented
Willingness to learn new skills and processes related to the development of Genscape's LNG products and services
Interest in researching/tracking information related to the North American natural gas market and its growing role in global gas markets through exportation of LNG
Experience using Excel to organize and analyze data
Possess strong time management skills
Dedication to superior customer service and exhibit a positive team-player attitude
Experience with any of the following: Advanced Excel (Pivot Tables, INDEX MATCH, VLOOKUP, Macros, data visualization, etc.)PostgreSQL, Python, R, and database knowledge
Economic analysis of oil and gas, with experience and interest at both a micro and macro scale

Knowledge and Skills Required:

Bachelor's Degree in a quantitative or business discipline (ie. Finance, Economics, Mathematics, Engineering, Geosciences, or a related field)
At least 1 year of related experience

Title: Technical Analyst, Business Operations
FullDescriptions:
Ibotta is one of the top mobile shopping applications on the App Store and Google Play. Our apps are used by millions of customers every month and we're looking for a Technical Analyst, Business Operations to come build something great with us. As part of the team, your extensive knowledge of system capabilities will inform the structure and strategy of campaigns that launch on the application. To be successful in this role, you must have excellent attention to detail, complete technical tasks at a fast pace, and take a collaborative approach to problem-solving.

What you'll do:

Manages technical setup and launch of all components in the application
Communicates and collects cross-departmental feedback to align on best practices and procedures
Anticipates issues and provides alternative methods of setup or delivery
Stays up to date on internal system changes and updates/educates impacted departments effectively
Analyzes, detects, identifies, and helps fix technical problems alongside Engineering and Product teams
Works closely with Analytics to target content to unique segments of consumers
Determines best methods of setup and execution for campaign optimizations in order to meet client needs and enhance user experience
Strategizes and implements Marketing initiatives to optimize user acquisition and retention
Completes assigned technical duties at a high level of independence under minimal supervision

What we are looking for:

Technical acumen and the aptitude to learn a variety of technical systems thoroughly and efficiently
Strong communication skills and ability to collaborate cross-departmentally to mitigate and troubleshoot issues
Ability to match client's business requirements with internal product capabilities
Strong desire to learn and navigate internal technical systems effectively
Ability to adapt to changing environment – responsive when priorities change and able to pivot workflow accordingly
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Proactive in initiating changes to make internal systems more efficient, resulting in higher productivity of current team members
BA/BS degree related to business or technology preferred
2+ years technical experience preferred
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel

About Us:
Headquartered in Denver, CO, Ibotta ("I bought a...") is a free app that's transforming the shopping experience by making every purchase rewarding. The company partners with leading brands and retailers to offer real cash back on groceries, travel, electronics, clothing, gifts, home and office supplies, dining out, and much more. Ibotta is the ultimate starting point for savings, and having paid out more than $500 million in cash rewards to its Savers, it's no surprise why Ibotta is one of the most downloaded shopping apps in the United States.

Learn more about Ibotta here: https://liferewarded.ibotta.com/press-and-media/ ( https://liferewarded.ibotta.com/press-and-media/ )

Additional Details:

This position is located in Denver, CO and includes competitive pay, benefits package (including medical, dental, vision), 401k, commuter stipend, and equity.
Ibotta provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, and genetics.
Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis.

Title: Intelligence Data Analyst
FullDescriptions:
Job Description
This position will Serve as a lead data links analyst in a Navy organization providing support that ensures data links remain active during exercise and operational environment. Participate in exercise development and execution, including advising on exercise objectives, tactical scenarios, and tactical data link architecture. Candidates must also possess a demonstrated ability to operate shifting priorities, adapt to a fast-paced environment, and deliver under pressure. This position is located on a client site and may require on-call SME support to a 24x7 military operations team.

Perform systems engineering to include research and development, to recommend the integration, installation, and training for sustainment and enhancement of existing data link architecture and network design to support emerging capabilities, advanced programs missions, Intelligence, Surveillance and Reconnaissance (ISR) (traditional and nontraditional) integration.
Identify the datalink architecture and network design parameters needed to connect the various operational units within the Joint Data Network (JDN).
Provide Datalink hardware/software management and maintenance. Interact with maintenance personnel to trouble shoot deficiencies and coordinate a resolution to the issue.
Support and System Administration support to configure, update and manage all servers and systems with configuration control updates for all applications supported with Government authorization
Provide system administration; operation, configuration management and provide training on installed Data Link Hosts to include Air Defense System Integrator (ADSI), National Tactical Data Manager (NTDM), Link Monitoring and Management Tool (LMMT), peripheral systems, and associated cryptographic equipment
Understanding of spectrum deconfliction, messages standards, and platform capabilities and limitations
Perform analysis of multi-TDL architecture performance and institute changes based on observations.
Represent customer at the joint and combined interoperability working groups.
Have knowledge on Cross Domain Solutions; their networks and interfaces and hardware and software and knowledgeable on the ICD 503 Risk Management Framework process
Have experience in the AFTTP 3-1 process and cycles, Joint publications and the DCR process, activities and test and evaluation reporting formats.
Desired Qualifications
Qualifications and Skills
To qualify for a Mid-Level JICO: Bachelor’s degree and 5+ years of data link experience, or, specialized training and 8 years specialized datalink experience, or equivalent academic/intelligence analysis experience.
To qualify for a Senior-Level Targeteer: Bachelor or master's degree with 10+ years of of data link experience or, specialized training and 15+ years of data link experience, or, equivalent intelligence/academic coursework. Credentialed subject matter expert or recognized specialist in relevant field.
Knowledge of the following data link systems: Link 16, Link 22, JREAP A/C, MADL, CEC, CDLMS, LMMT, MIDS, JRE, CMN4, and NMT
Must be familiar with: National Tactical Data Manager (NTDM), Multi-Source Correlation System (MSCS) Multi-TDL Display System (MTDS), Joint Range Extension (JRE), Multi-Source Correlator Tracker (MSCT) and Force XXI Battle Command, Brigade and Below (FBCB2), Trusted Manager II, Radiant Mercury, and other applicable cross domain solutions and associated data networks, hardware and software.

Required Qualifications and Certifications
Active TS/SCI Clearance with CI Poly (or agreement to take poly when requested)
Joint Interface Control Officer Certification
Position Location: Denver, CO

Title: Energy Market Data Analyst
FullDescriptions:
Join ABB and work in a team that is dedicated to creating a future where innovative digital technologies allow greater access to cleaner energy.
ABB (ABBN: SIX Swiss Ex) is a technology leader that is driving the digital transformation of industries. With a history of innovation spanning more than 130 years, ABB has four customer-focused, globally leading businesses: Electrification, Industrial Automation, Motion, and Robotics & Discrete Automation, supported by the ABB Ability™ digital platform. ABB’s Power Grids business will be divested to Hitachi in 2020. ABB operates in more than 100 countries with about 147,000 employees. www.abb.com

In addition, ABB is a world leader in the energy market from grid infrastructure to robotics to market analysis. The Energy Market Data Analyst role supports multiple products in the Enterprise Software group, providing data and insights to a broad spectrum of clients.

You are a motivated and passionate person who thrives on a dynamic team, building and maintaining business-critical data sets from a variety of sources. Your insightful problem-solving skills and clever collaboration will help drive technical innovation, strengthen relationships, and deliver absolute excellence. Your client focus will help ensure the growth, popularity, and longevity of the products you support. Your relentless curiosity and drive for self-improvement will ensure your continual growth and satisfaction in this position while leading to other opportunities within ABB.

ABB is currently seeking an Energy Market Data Analyst for its Broomfield, Colorado location. The responsibilities in this role include supporting multiple products in the Enterprise Software group, providing data as well as insights to a broad spectrum of clients. In this role, you will work with your scrum team to ensure complete, high-quality data in the Velocity Suite and EMI products.

Your responsibilities
Support and educate clients to maximize product value in their organization
Drive process and product improvements through data analysis and client input
Identify data sources to improve Velocity Suite and other products
Own responsibility for a set group of data from identification through development, integration, product creation and maintenance
Improve data collection, quality control, and process monitoring through proofs, test cases, dashboards, and other innovations
Test internal and externally facing software releases to ensure efficiency and quality
Communicate and collaborate on a scrum team and across teams to drive excellent quality in all processes
Your background
Bachelor's degree (B. S.) from four-year college or university in Mathematics, Economics, Data science, Energy, GIS, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or an Engineering discipline and minimum 3+ years of experience analyzing energy related market data
Ideally this role could be filled at a more senior level should the candidate meet the following:
Bachelor's degree (B. S.) from four-year college or university in Mathematics, Economics, Data science, Energy, GIS, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or an Engineering discipline and minimum 5+ years of experience analyzing energy related market data
Knowledge of agile process and principles
Understanding of data collection techniques and principles
Experience managing data with a focus on performance and quality
Exposure to North American data is beneficial and extracontinental data exposure is ideal, including but not limited to:
Independent System Operators (ISOs)
Natural gas pipelines
Electricity generation and transmission
Renewable energy sources such as wind and solar
Grid battery storage
Strong SQL querying and analysis in Oracle, Microsoft, and/or MySQL is needed
A grasp of PL/SQL, NoSQL, Python, R, and other analytical tools is beneficial
Knowledge of Geographic Information Systems (GIS) including ArcGIS, MapInfo, QGIS, or related open source GIS systems is a plus
Experience with regular expressions, machine learning and big data analytics are sought
Team player with outstanding communication, presentation and collaboration skills
Curious and driven learner interested in continual personal and career growth
Emotionally intelligent communication and presentation skills
Knowledge and experience with market research
Excellent organizational and time-management skills
Sharp analytical and problem-solving skills
Creative and detail-oriented in all aspects

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Qualifications:
Prior Business Intelligence and SQL experience is required.
Epic certification within six months of hire or six months from the beginning of Epic implementation at Boulder Community Health.
Education: Bachelor’s degree in engineering, physics, computer sciences, math, information systems, or statistics or equivalent experience
FullDescriptions:
Full-time - 40 hours/week
Boulder Community Health was recently honored as Best Local Employer by the Daily Camera in the 2018 Boulder County Gold, their People’s Choice Awards for businesses in Boulder County. Come join us and be a part of an independent, community-focused health system and feel good knowing that your work will make a difference in people’s lives and be a positive contribution to the community.
POSITION SUMMARY
Business Intelligence Analyst designs and writes reports based on an in-depth knowledge of
Operational system usage. This level of knowledge requires a deep understanding of system build, end-user workflows, and patterns of use. The Business Intelligence Analyst must have both the technical skills required to design and write reports and the operational knowledge to understand what report consumers need. This position works with Business Intelligence applications and writes SQL queries to retrieve, interpret and produce data/information for the organization. The Business Intelligence Analyst will also have a good understanding of the current Business Intelligence application(s) and how to create and enhance applications.
JOB QUALIFICATIONS
Education or Formal Training
Bachelor’s degree in engineering, physics, computer sciences, math, information systems, or statistics or equivalent experience
Special Qualifications (Licensure, Registration, etc.)
Prior Business Intelligence and SQL experience is required.
Epic certification within six months of hire or six months from the beginning of Epic implementation at Boulder Community Health.
Knowledge, Skill and Ability
Have ability in creating/maintaining Business Intelligence applications including but not limited to financial/clinical data visual display and interpretation.
Solid working knowledge and application of data abstraction, validation and interpretation principals in the healthcare environment.
Proficiency with SQL and relational database concepts.
Demonstrate experience and proficiency with report writing tools.
Ability to determine data structures that benefit the entire reporting environment.
Ability to analyze and think critically.
Can utilize SSRS in fulfilling data requests as appropriate.
A confidence and skill in effectively communicating, both written and verbal, to all levels of the organization.
Must be resourceful, working with minimum guidance and oversight, in meeting project goals and timeframes.
Ability in time management, working with several projects and assignments that are in progress at the same time.
Must be proactive and flexible in daily work environment.
Ability to gain an in-depth understanding of the data model through data model classes geared toward specific Epic applications
Experience
Familiarity with complex database structures.
For financial reporting: Prior experience working with an AR (Accounts Receivable) system is desirable, but not required.
For clinical reporting: Prior experience working with an EMR (Electronic Medical Record) system is desirable, but not required.
WORKING ENVIRONMENT/PHYSICAL ACTIVITIES
Visual acuity required for work at computer terminal for up to 8 hours a day and to read reports with compressed (20 CPI) printing
Ability to lift 20 pounds
INTERRELATIONSHIPS
Communicates with VPs, Directors and Managers in oral and written form to receive requests for information and reports. Provides education on use and interpretation of reports in a calm and non-inflammatory fashion. Under the direction of the Director, interacts with outside organizations. Works especially close with the Information Technology Department, QlikView Analysts and the Enterprise Analytics’ staff.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Reviews Foundation System reports and identifying advanced analytics needs with report consumers.
Meets with Application Reporting Leads and requestors to understand their data needs.
Creates design specifications for new reports.
Identifies and reviewing the appropriate technological solutions for various reporting needs.
Creates reports, using a third-party report writing tool such as Crystal reports, to display Clarity data.
Modifies existing reports, as necessary.
Distributes Clarity reports to report consumers using Epic-Crystal integration.
Reviews peer reports for validity.
Tests report build in a specified testing environment and volume testing in live environments.
Reviews upgrade documentation related to Clarity features and released Crystal reporting content, and determining how to implement the changes.
Business intelligence Analysts might also be responsible for building:
Universes/Cubes
Extracts
SlicerDicer
Third-party tools (Xcelsius/WebI/QlikView/Explorer
Reports to query Cogito Caboodle
About Boulder Community Health and Boulder, Colorado
Uncompromising medical excellence, delivered with the values of respect and compassion. Since 1922, Boulder Community Health has built our reputation on this promise. As a community-owned and operated not-for-profit hospital and clinics, we remain dedicated to meeting the evolving healthcare needs of our citizens and providing access to high quality medical care. Our state-of-the art facilities are home to many medical professionals who offer an extensive range of medical services.
Nestled in the foothills of the Rocky Mountains, adventure awaits you right outside your door. Big, beautiful vistas, serene snow-capped mountains, and a lifestyle conducive to enjoying the outdoors bring a truly fresh perspective to our practice of healthcare.
Surround yourself by natural beauty and an active, life-embracing community, while you enjoy state of the art facilities and equipment along with a competitive compensation and benefits package, including health/dental/life, paid annual leave, tuition reimbursement and much more.
EOE/Affirmative Action/Drug-free workplace

Title: Development Analyst
FullDescriptions:
UDR is excited to announce an opening for a Development Analyst at our corporate office in Highlands Ranch, CO.


GENERAL SUMMARY OF DUTIES: Work with senior members of the development team to analyze the profitability of potential deals, model development proformas, and gather market/rent comp data. Assist in providing financial analysis, modeling, and support for all the Company’s new business development activities in the real estate industry. Provide research and analysis on various topics related to various projects. Participate in the management of active developments.

SUPERVISION RECEIVED: Reports directly to a Development Associate, Director – Development or Senior Director – Development


SUPERVISION EXERCISED: N/A

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

1. Produce financial modeling spreadsheets.
2. Build and maintain reports and databases on land sales, forward supply, market data, and other statistics.
3. Receive, analyze, and summarize market studies. Establish intimate knowledge base of target markets.
4. Assist in the creation and assembly of presentations, investment memos, design update memos, and other correspondence utilizing PowerPoint, Excel and MS Word.
5. Attend Owner-Architect-Contractor (“OAC”) meetings to support the development of project program and design.
6. Track project expenditures versus budget. Maintain financial forecasts for active developments.
7. Research local property tax rates, local impact fees, and entitlement costs to ensure an accurate reflection of total development costs.
8. Review third-party market reports to supplement the organizations’ operating data in order to make appropriate operating and expense projections for the proposed development.
9. Work with other members of the development team during the due diligence process to ensure issues related to the potential impact on project performance are reviewed. Provide sensitivity analysis to evaluate the impact of certain variables.
10. Review and summarize city documents.
11. Compile and manage project schedules.
12. Support development managers in tasks such as acquisition of utilities, permits, and other project needs.
13. Prepare and distribute monthly development reports to senior members of the team.
14. Perform other duties as assigned or as necessary.
PERFORMANCE REQUIREMENTS: Knowledge of organizational policies and procedures, fiscal management, and office management techniques. Knowledge and understanding of business research principles, processes, and techniques. Ability to apply policies and procedures to solve company issues.

Ability to think conceptually and translate concepts into practical applications solutions and decisions. Ability to demonstrate and execute practical and effective solutions to problems. Must have a strong work ethic, integrity, and good business acumen. Ability to analyze data and recommend strategy. Ability to read, analyze, and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures, or governmental regulations. Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions. Ability to apply concepts of basic algebra, geometry, and statistics.


Monitors and ensures compliance with regulatory requirements, federal, state, and local laws and organizational standards. Identifies and reports potential risk areas and supports the problem resolution. Ability to travel.

Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Ability to effectively present information to and respond to questions from management or team members. Ability to establish priorities and coordinate work activities. Ability to write reports, business correspondence, and procedure manuals.

Knowledge of fiscal management and office management techniques with strong skills regarding spreadsheets, word processing and database applications. Strong experience and demonstrated aptitude with MS Excel. Ability to process computer data and to format and generate reports. Ability to create, compose, and edit written materials.

TYPICAL PHYSICAL DEMANDS: Requires mobility sufficient to travel. Some bending, stooping and stretching. Occasionally lifting items weighing up to 30 lbs. Requires eye-hand coordination and manual dexterity sufficient to operate a keyboard, photocopier, telephone, calculator, and other office equipment. Requires normal range of hearing and eyesight to record, prepare, and communicate appropriate reports. Extensive data input and required ability to sit for long periods of time. Regular and consistent attendance on the job is an essential function.

TYPICAL WORKING CONDITIONS: Normal office environment. Occasional evening or weekend work. Occasional travel may be required. The position will be based in Denver.

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:

1. Bachelor’s degree in business, finance, economics, architecture, civil engineering, urban planning, or related field.
2. Graduate degree preferred.
3. Minimum of one to two years experience within the real estate industry preferred.
4. Must have and maintain a valid driver’s license unless otherwise noted

Title: Data Analyst

Bachelor’s degree – Mathematics, Statistics, Business, Information Technology, Information Systems degrees preferred
Experience with SQL and managing relational databases including writing complex queries
Experience and/or interest in other programming languages including Python, VBA and Bash
Experience with Linux
Minimum two years of experience with data/IT analysis
Strong proficiency in all Microsoft applications
Experience in healthcare claims analytics is preferred
Knowledge of medical claims terminology - CPT, ICD-9/ICD-10
Experience working within SDLC framework
Experience with Cognos Analytics
Interest and strengths in data analysis and innovation
Desire and willingness to learn and develop new technical skills
Focus on analytical process improvement using technical resources available
Build relationships with both internal and external partners and clients
A self-starter mentality and thoughtful execution abilities

An upbeat, team-oriented attitude
FullDescriptions:
Are you a tech savvy burgeoning data guru with exceptional communication skills looking for an opportunity to support two of DaVita’s most exciting and strategic businesses? If your answer is “Yes!” then we have the perfect role for you.
What is the Role Where you Can Add Value?
We are actively recruiting for a Data Analyst to support both the DaVita Health Solutions and Integrated Kidney Care business units, which are at the center of DaVita’s strategy for the future of DaVita’s evolution from a fee for service to value based world. The primary responsibility of this teammate is to support the growth of DaVita’s integrated care businesses with commercial payors by supporting the data needs of the business units and maintaining the server environment.
In this critical role Data Analyst will work as a key member of the data analytics team, facilitating program data analytics for current and prospective clients, which includes data intake, analysis, and reporting key metrics necessary for leadership decision-making. In addition to receiving and transforming data received from external partners, the Data Analyst will support the data analytics team by creating, implementing and maintaining automated processes related to data intake, data manipulation and reporting by utilizing the technical resources available. They will also focus on process improvement within the data analytics environment and ensure data management best practices.
The Data Analyst will work with a team of highly motivated, fast-paced, senior executives with extensive experience in start-ups, consulting, private equity, and operations. The environment is highly collaborative and team oriented with a differential focus on both professional and personal growth. The analyst must be able to work successfully with cross-functional teams and have the maturity to interact directly with both peers and executives across departments. The following duties and responsibilities generally reflect the expectations of this position but are not intended to be all inclusive. Additional responsibilities include the following:
Provide analytical support for current and prospective clients
Load, cleanse, and summarize claims and other data from payor and provider partners
Deliver unique insights from data by preforming both ad-hoc and standardized analyses
Develop and maintain procedures that support the team’s reporting capabilities
Write SQL queries against data warehouses
Database/server maintenance
Set up automation and procedures for new clients or new processes (in SQL, Python, VBA and Bash)
Support team by maintaining automated processes
Comply with SDLC processes
Process improvement

FullDescriptions:
Summary
DISH is a Fortune 250 company with more than $13 billion in annual revenue that continues to redefine the communications industry. Our legacy is innovation and a willingness to challenge the status quo, including reinventing ourselves. We disrupted the pay-TV industry in the mid-90s with the launch of the DISH satellite TV service, taking on some of the largest U.S. corporations in the process, and grew to be the fourth-largest pay-TV provider. We are doing it again with the first live, internet-delivered TV service – Sling TV – that bucks traditional pay-TV norms and gives consumers a truly new way to access and watch television.

Now we have our sights set on upending the wireless industry and unseating the entrenched incumbent carriers.

We are driven by curiosity, pride, adventure, and a desire to win – it's in our DNA. We're looking for people with boundless energy, intelligence, and an overwhelming need to achieve to join our team as we embark on the next chapter of our story.

Opportunity is here. We are DISH.

Job Duties and Responsibilities
TheBusiness Operations Analyst will be a part of the Workforce Management Team with the overarching responsibility of resource optimization and scheduling operations for the Customer Experience Organization. The analyst is responsible for efficient resource allocation to maintain target service levels across all business lines and will provide analytical support involving routine and ad hoc analysis.
Primary duties fall into the following categories:

Schedule 5000+ call center agents across the globe
Make recommendations as needed to meet service level goals by skill, site, day of week, and time of day; lead staffing review meetings with management and analysts discussing historical and future scheduling results
Work closely with the call centers, IT and vendor teams to set goals, implement initiatives, and monitor feedback loops to ensure quick updates to stakeholders and to identify any required changes in strategy
Create and maintain tracking tools to optimize performance, and perform ad hoc analysis and/or reporting as needed
Analyze data and identify opportunities for performance improvements in the optimization and scheduling process and implement solutions
Partner with forecast and skill managers across all business lines to understand customer demand and staffing capacity assumptions and constraints, collaborate on solutions for existing barriers, communicate across all levels of management and implement solutions
Learn and master the use of Teleopti WFM software application
Skills - Experience and Requirements
A successful Workforce Planning Analyst will have the following:

Bachelor's degree from a four-year college or university in an analytical field or an equivalent combination of education and experience in analytical fields
Strong analytical and mathematical skills to collect and interpret data and to solve problems required
Knowledge of probability and statistics highly desired; knowledge of data mining and analysis tools including MS Excel, SQL, R, Python, etc. desired
Project management experience and strong organization and time-management skills required
Strong oral and written communication skills with all levels of personnel, and ability to multitask in a fast-paced environment
Ability to work independently as well as with a team required

Title: Digital Analyst / Media Trader
FullDescriptions:
Apply at begin@delvepartners.com with your resume and cover letter.
Digital Analytics and Media Trading: Industry Background
Digital Analytics and Media Trading have been one of the fastest growing industries over the last 15 years. The growth within the industry continues to accelerate. The industry changes rapidly and offers rewarding career opportunities. We encourage you to review the following sample articles relevant to Digital Analytics/Media Trading:
Importance of Digital Analytics: https://www.emarketer.com/Article/Data-Analytics-Hot-Right-Now/1011841
Explosive growth in Programmatic Media Trading: https://www.emarketer.com/Article/More-Than-Two-Thirds-of-US-Digital-Display-Ad-Spending-Programmatic/1013789
Rapid shift from TV to Digital Ad spending: https://www.emarketer.com/Article/US-Digital-Ad-Spending-Surpass-TV-this-Year/1014469
———
Position Description: Digital Analyst / Media Trader – full time
Do you enjoy diving into data and finding patterns? Are you interesting in learning what drives sales for any ecommerce business, using advanced digital data analysis techniques? Would you enjoy the excitement – and riskiness – associated with handling hundreds of thousands of dollars when trading digital media on the clients’ behalf? Would you like to develop an analytical, media, technical and business skillset that will allow you to ultimately ascend to leadership positions at any brand that has online presence?
We are looking for candidates for Data Analyst / Media Trader Positions, at DELVE, a #1-rated Google Analytics and DoubleClick Partner. We encourage you to read Reviews from over 30 DELVE customers here on our Google Partner Page.
In this role, you need to be prepared to “work hard and play hard”, and in return will receive professional growth and financial satisfaction.
Data Tools – You should like data and numbers. You really need to enjoy and be proficient in Excel. If you can code, that’s wonderful, but not necessary. However, you also should appreciate how PowerPoint can assist in communicating a complex data-exploration process during a client call.
Technology – We will teach you about digital analytics and media platforms, and how to extract insights to help clients “win with honest data”, using our “Clear ROI” media attribution methodology. You will be working with what we consider to be the ‘best in class’ AdTech, the DoubleClick by Google ‘stack’.
Clean Data – We will educate you about the process of looking at a brand’s digital data, how to clean it to create the foundation for future insights, and how tools such as Google Analytics or Google Tag Manager are essential to any online business’s intelligence capabilities.
Analysis– You should be excited about conducting basic or advanced data analysis – alone or with your team-mates. To succeed at Delve, optimally you should find it fun and satisfying when working with small or large data-sets (e.g. using Excel), and identifying patters that prove or disprove a given hypothesis. You don’t need to be a Math or Engineering major, but you need to have the rigor to think through an analytics problem step by step, while being open minded and creative.
Insight and Results – We will teach you how to analyze data, and explain patterns/insights to clients – you will learn how to explain and influence using logic and data. We aim to help clients reallocate time and money from business activities that don’t work, to marketing tactics that deliver value to the brand.
Communication – Finally, and critically, you will be exposed to regular communications with clients; eventually helping manage client calls on both Google Analytics/Google Tag Manager and Media/DoubleClick Engagements. Listening and understanding each client’s individual needs, requirements and expectations is something that you are going to learn over time.
Also, overtime:
– Project Management – You will be trained to project manage the activities and tasks in-between client calls.
– Strategic Planning – Preparing monthly and quarterly presentations to synthesize what has been completed to date and provide plans through the next quarter.
– Account Management – Working with leadership to track budgets and investments for each client and project. Provide forecasts for future needs and educate and explain to clients new ideas to grow their business.
———
Who should apply:
Seniors graduating in May 2020; all Majors are encouraged to apply
When to apply
At your earliest convenience
How to apply:
Please email:
Cover Letter,
Resume (thank you for sharing your SAT / GMAT scores and GPA in your Resume), and
an Unofficial Transcript,
to grow@delvepartners.com
——————————————————————————————————————————————
If invited to an interview, please be ready to address and discuss the following:
You should be able to explain why you are interested in learning how to become a Digital Analyst / Media Trader using platforms such as Google Analytics, AdWords, Facebook or DoubleClick. We encourage you to read the following content prior to interviewing:
Digital Analytics (Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager):
https://www.google.com/analytics
https://developers.google.com/analytics/devguides/collection/
Media Trading (DoubleClick Bid Manager, AdWords, Facebook Business)
Display with DoubleClick: https://www.doubleclickbygoogle.com/solutions/digital-marketing/
Paid Search with AdWords: https://adwords.google.com
Paid Social with Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/business/overview
Keen interest in digital business philosophies, being genuinely excited about the growth within the Digital Analytics and Media Trading industry are a ‘must’.
Excellent analytical skills
Willingness to participate in meetings and communicate insights with clients (who are at CMO, VP or Director level) over phone or in person
Ultimately, desire to inspire clients with engaging data storytelling; being emphatic, thoughtful and compelling.

Title: Medical Safety Data Analyst Global
FullDescriptions:
Date: Oct 3, 2019
Location: Lakewood, CO, US
Company: Terumo BCT, Inc.
Requisition ID: 23885
Terumo BCT is looking for a Medical Safety Analyst to performs post-market surveillance tasks with a focus on identifying adverse events related to marketed products using traditional and non-traditional health data sources (e.g., clinical and administrative datasets and databases).


Identifies known residual and emerging health risks and monitors the causes and conditions resulting in adverse health effects relevant to the lifecycle management of marketed products by developing and maintaining multiple internal and public-facing local, national, and global health surveillance, medical device, pharmaco- and hemovigilance systems using various analytical and reporting tools (e.g., SAS, SQL). Participates in the monitoring, reporting, investigation and analysis of adverse events related to the donation, processing and transfusion of blood products (i.e. hemovigilance).
WHAT YOU’LL DO
Manage safety and relevant data collection tools including safety surveillance databases, clinical, blood bank, and/or patient registries and data storage repositories to ensure data integrity and accuracy
Conduct data validation as well as data mining/extraction and manipulation to generate datasets
Consult with internal and external analytic stakeholders to lead and support in-depth safety analyses including gathering informational and business needs, defining analytic plans and business requirements, conducting statistical analyses, and summarizing findings in relevant reports and presentations (i.e. hemovigilance reports).
Participate in relevant safety data analysis and interpretation activities for PMCF studies, clinical investigations, and investigator-initiated studies
Search and review adverse event data, literature, and other safety-relevant data for the purpose of signal surveillance, detection, and processing
WHAT YOU NEED
Master’s degree in a clinical-research related field of discipline such as a Master’s in Public Health (MPH), Clinical/Health Informatics, or Biostatistics
Training in Epidemiology, Biostatistics, or Health Surveillance is a plus
Experience with health data mining, database management, and research dataset generation
Experience working with clinical registries, public health surveillance systems
SKILLS YOU’LL USE
Ability to create and manage research datasets from patient registries, health surveillance systems, clinical data repositories, and other primary and secondary data collection tools
Ability to analyze various datasets, interpret results, and convey complex scientific data in a clear, concise, and understandable manner to a scientific as well as non-scientific audience
Ability to gather data from multiple sources and references and formulate summary reports
Ability to identify major data trends, prepare graphs and measurement tools as appropriate, and report variances
Knowledge and understanding of the drug/device development and lifecycle management processes
Ability to critically appraise literature and perform literature search, evaluation, and assessment, as needed
Proficient in SAS and relevant research software
We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Affirmative Action Employer. All applicants will be afforded equal opportunity without discrimination because of race, color, religion, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, order of protection status, national origin or ancestry, citizenship status, age, physical or mental disability unrelated to ability, military status or an unfavorable discharge from military service.
Terumo BCT is committed to providing a safe and secure working environment. We maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing and detailed background verification checks. To this end, all employment offers for positions in the U.S. are conditional upon successful completion of Terumo BCT's pre-employment screening process. As of January 1, 2017 the Terumo BCT Lakewood, Colorado location will be a tobacco-free workplace. For more information about Terumo BCT, visit our website www.terumobct.com/careers .

Join Terumo BCT as we unlock the potential of blood. We are a global leader in blood component and cellular technologies, and the only company with the unique combination of apheresis collections, manual and automated whole blood processing, and pathogen reduction coupled with leading technologies in therapeutic apheresis and cell processing. We believe in the potential of blood to do even more for patients than it does today. This belief inspires our innovation and strengthens our collaboration with customers.
As the largest medical device manufacturing company headquartered in Colorado, we are home to more than 2,300 associates and our products are in use in more than 125 countries and territories. Our Global footprint includes more than 5,500 associates and partners with regional headquarters in Brussels, Buenos Aires, Singapore and Tokyo.
Our company has almost $1B in annual revenues and has been voted and recognized as:

Flexential stands for something not often found in the world of IT transformation: the human touch. The best infrastructure solutions aren’t about infrastructure, they’re about people. With a mission to accelerate customer success through people and technology, we build trusted relationships and deliver tailored, value-added and reliable solutions to demonstrate the power of people in a technical world.
Utilizing our people, values and reliable performance, Flexential is deeply invested in the success of our 4,200+ customers, who trust us to deliver core data center solutions of colocation and connectivity, as well as cloud, managed solutions and professional services. Flexential’s robust suite of assets spans 21 domestic and international markets and comprises 41 highly redundant and connectivity-rich data centers.
Investing in our people, we have an exciting opportunity for a Sr. Business/Data Analyst – Product Analytics in the Denver, CO area to join our team!

As a Product Analytics Business Analyst, you will join a fast-growing technology organization, identifying ways to improve the performance our current product portfolio and supporting the development of new product offers. We are a fast-paced and highly-collaborative group, with the goal of growing our company above the market rate through a uniquely competitive product set in the IaaS and cloud services market. Collaborating across the organization, you will work to establish and maintain a product decision support and product performance reporting process, through the entire product lifecycle (design, launch, and maintain).

Finally, and most importantly, analyze the data above to provide information to the product organization and executive management, in order to drive the Flexential product line forward.In other words, identify the “story” within the data.

Excellent verbal and interpersonal communications skills
